Post ID:2718
Sender:"peoples campaign" <nbpc_2002@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-04-27 20:10:24
Subject:Re: dave/arthur special delivery - - UNITY & STRUGGLE  BULLETIN  - -  4 /19/02
Message:

this is a very dangerous position.

hungerford/henson wrote:

>Although this piece on its own makes almost no case for Ras, I hope to see
>him elected. Neither the stifling 1970 Old Guard nor the downtown/Booker 
>New
>Guard have anything to offer the great majority of Newark's residents. Ras
>will bring a new voice, he will raise considerable interest in the
>community. The only real test of what he can do with a seat on the Council
>will be what happens when he gets one.


a boycott position of the mayoral race - that HOPES ras gets elected.
what are you doing hungerford/henson to, not hope but rather "TAKE IT 
PERSONAL"?

get out the vote effort - EVERY DAY! 350-370 west Market St contact 
973.242.0522


>From: "David Hungerford" <dbh@...>
>Reply-To: poprogress@yahoogroups.com
>To: <poprogress@yahoogroups.com>
>Subject: Re: [poprogress] special delivery - - UNITY & STRUGGLE �BULLETIN 
>�- -��4 /19/02
>Date: Fri, 26 Apr 2002 21:41:48 -0700
>
>Adherents of the Democrats are free to say what they want about their 
>party.
>What they may not do is claim their devotion to it amounts to Marxism.
>
>Let us look at U&S' statement, "The Trojan Horse," about this year's Newark
>municipal election. It begins with this:
>
>Communists & REVOLUTIONARY DEMOCRATS understand that there can be no
>socialist revolution without the completion of the Democratic Revolution.
>(See Lenin, Mao)"
>
>The more important thing is unsaid: there is no democracy for the working
>class and the oppressed nationalities without revolution. (That was what
>Lenin and Mao were about.) The posture of democracy first, then socialism,
>is consistent throughout. It amounts to reformism, not Marxism.
>
>The antics of "Black & Latino Bourgeois Democratic politicians" in New York
>and Los Angeles are described as "betrayal" of the principle of 
>Black-Latino
>unity. They're not betraying their bourgeois "principles" of anything. The
>principle of multinational unity only has meaning for the oppressed on a
>working class basis. Nowhere in this piece is the class content of the
>principle explained.
>
>A list of Cory Booker's sins is described to prove he is--a Republican! The
>problem is that everything on the list is typical as well of Democrats,
>like, um . . . Cory Booker. The real Trojan horse against the people isn't
>just Booker, it's the whole Democratic Party. Sharpe James is also a
>Democrat. Why is he an alternative?
>
>The paper's assessment of Sharpe is accurate enough. The difference comes
>down to his wispy national bourgeois aspects. These mean absolutely nothing
>without the political self-activity of the masses. To put this unwarranted
>emphasis on James is outright subjection to bourgeois leadership. U&S must
>also be taxed with Joseph Smith's demands (don't try to disavow him, U&S!)
>that other groups should drop their own activities, like the May 15
>Statewide March Against Police Brutality, in favor of Newark election
>activity.
>
>The piece supports Ras Baraka's campaign. That is a different matter from
>James. A comparison is made with the united front against Japanese
>imperialism of the Communist Party of China and the Kuomintang party of the
>landlords and capitalists. The problem here is the piece doesn't justify 
>the
>comparison. (Mao said political power grows out of the barrel of a gun.
>That's exactly how the Communists later ran the Kuomintang out of
>continental China.)
>
>A number of "revolutionary democratic" program points are put forth. They
>are only revolutionary if put forth as class struggle. For example, the
>program of community control of the police is only revolutionary if aimed 
>at
>ending the armed rule of the bourgeoisie over the ruling class.
>
>Even so, no democratic program is in and of itself revolutionary. The
>democratic program is necessary to revolution, but not sufficient. The
>bourgeois state can never be overthrow by purely democratic means. To 
>forget
>this is to forget Marxism and fall into reformism.
>
>Nowhere does the paper's discussion of mass organization go beyond
>bourgeois-legal means. Most importantly, the need for a new and genuine
>Communist Party to lead the working class and the oppressed to proletarian
>revolution is ignored.
>
>Although this piece on its own makes almost no case for Ras, I hope to see
>him elected. Neither the stifling 1970 Old Guard nor the downtown/Booker 
>New
>Guard have anything to offer the great majority of Newark's residents. Ras
>will bring a new voice, he will raise considerable interest in the
>community. The only real test of what he can do with a seat on the Council
>will be what happens when he gets one.
>
>
>
>----- Original Message -----
>From: "peoples campaign" <nbpc_2002@...>
>To: <poprogress@yahoogroups.com>
>Sent: Thursday, April 25, 2002 9:35 PM
>Subject: [poprogress] special delivery - - UNITY & STRUGGLE  BULLETIN  - -
>4 /19/02
>
>
> >
> > UNITY & STRUGGLE BULLETIN 4 /19/02
> >
> >
> > The Trojan Horse
> >
> > Communists & REVOLUTIONARY DEMOCRATS understand that there can be
> > no socialist revolution without the completion of the Democratic
>Revolution.
> > (See Lenin, Mao). They also know that the Revolutionaries must take the
>lead
> > in the completion of a Democratic Revolution and even when utilizing the
> > bourgeois instrument of Electoral Politics, must use it to forward the
> > themes, the political lines, the ideological clarity of the 
>revolutionary
> > leaders of the Working Class.
> > For these reasons Revolutionaries running in bourgeois elections never
> > consider Only their own candidacy, but take in to consideration the
>critical
> > needs and issues of the working class. If they narrow their view to
>consider
> > Only their own election to a seat, and do not put out the issues and
>themes
> > that affect the whole working class, then they have become somewhat
> > politically retarded so that their "insurgency" is reduced to the narrow
> > career considerations of the petty bourgeois democrat !
> > In the Newark elections of May 14, Ras Baraka and in the alliance with 
>the
> > Puerto Rican north ward candidate, Hector Corchado, are without a doubt
>the
> > most progressive force in the election. The very political strength and
> > democratic leadership that their alliance has projected "Black-Latino
>Unity"
> > draws the entire mass base of the grassroots constituency together, in
> > defiance of the bogus "teams" both mayoral candidates have projected 
>which
> > excludes both Baraka and Corchado.
> > This theme is especially relevant and necessary because of the betrayals
>to
> > this unity which were demonstrated in the New York City and Los Angeles
> > Mayoral contests where Black & Latino Bourgeois Democratic politicians
> > sabotaged that unity so that both Latino Mayoral candidates were 
>defeated
> > and so called "moderate" whites were elected. Bloomberg in NYC spent 59
> > million and bought colored quislings on the spot. Hahn in LA using the
>beard
> > of his father's bravery in meeting Dr. King at the airport, and his palm
> > greasing of Negro politicians, zig zagged his way into office, and upon
> > being elected immediately announced that he was firing the Black Police
> > Chief. Now the Negroes are whining, betrayal. But it was their betrayal
> > which allowed Hahn's.
> > In Newark, some people believe that as long as they vote for RAS BARAKA
>and
> > HECTOR CORCHADO, they have fulfilled their progressive obligations so 
>that
> > they can covertly vote for the Wall St Trojan Horse, Corey Booker. But
>this
> > is simply a failure to closely examine and analyze the entire meaning of
> > this campaign.
> > On one hand you have Sharpe James, in public office since the 
>Community's
> > Choice Campaign of 1970. He is part of the Afro American National
> > Bourgeoisie. Always compromising with Corporate Capital, usually shaky 
>in
> > confronting the big dogs of government and business. an important
>operative
> > in the Democratic Party, usually self hypnotized by the beauties of his
>ego,
> > never completely honest, manipulative, capable of any trick, betrayal,
>scam
> > one can think of.
> > Yet he is the national bourgeoisie, as shaky as Chiang Kai Chek, and on
>site
> > representative of the self promoting Tonto politics of the congressional
> > black caucus, though there are a few exceptions. But the National
> > Bourgeoisie for all its weak wavering dishonest compromise is a flawed 
>but
> > actual representative of "Home Rule", a very weak example of this city's
> > Self Determination. That it is so weak must also raise questions of the
> > weakness of Newark's would be revolutionaries.
> > Corey Booker, on the other hand, is a Comprador, straight out. He has
>raised
> > earlier, 795,000 from Wall St. (See Star Ledger, NYTimes) and another
> > 400,000 from New Jersey suburbs! Now that figure is nearly three million
> > dollars! Including contributions from Goldman- Sachs Brokerage, Jack 
>Kemp,
> > the National Republican party, &C . With over One Million dollars raised
> > from Outside Newark,
> > It indicates that those are his true sponsors and backers.
> > In addition, Booker is an active Republican. Yes, the Republicans of 
>Bush,
> > Ashcroft, Thomas, Whitman, budget cuts, tax rebates to the corporations,
> > Enron, World Trade Center suspiciousness, Afghanistan, Enablers of
>Sharon's
> > Massacre Crusade of the Palestinians, Spy plane over China, Confederate
> > Flag, Environmental Terror, Right wing election crooks, &c &C
> > Booker escorted Bush 2's Spouse Laura, Republican Senate Candidate Bob
> > Franks and the super rightist Gubernatorial candidate Bret Schundler
>through
> > Newark. Booker backs Privatization, Charter Schools, the general
>Republican
> > anti -working class anti -minority anti -immigrant , pro corpora-e 
>Agenda.
> > He is quite simply a Trojan horse for the Republican initiative to take
> > Newark, now that they have been kicked out of Trenton.
> > For the people of Newark, a Republican victory would mean the 
>Destruction
>of
> > the Public School System, The Privatization of the businesses and
>resources
> > that will come from the building of the Arena, the privatization of the
> > entire so called Newark Renaissance. Ironically, when Booker claims to 
>be
> > calling for the benefits of this renaissance to be spread among the 
>whole
> > Newark Community not just for Downtown. We must realize Booker Is
>Downtown.
> > A representative of Corporate Republican Interests . They are his
>Sponsors,
> > not the people of Newark!
> > If Booker's Economic base is Right Wing Corporate , his social base is 
>the
> > suburban Yuppies and Buppies who form the majority of his staff. His
>triumph
> > would mean the Elimination of 16,000 jobs from the City Hall Infra
>structure
> > and staffs. These jobs would then be refilled by the suburban white 
>Yuppie
> > and Buppie Negro contingent, already easing in with NJPAC, and city 
>hall's
> > offices would become almost instantly "foreign" i.e., the other part of
>the
> > middle management largely white college crowd who will also be the staff
> > for the new businesses coming into the city. The young folks who the new
> > downtown condominiums are being built!
> > It is as simple as Home Rule Vs Foreign Domination. Self Determination 
>Vs
> > Corporate Rule! Mao made a United Front with Chiang Kai Chek's 
>Kuomintang
> > against the Japanese Imperialists, but when the Japanese were defeated
> > Chiang tried to destroy the Revolutionaries led by Mao , but were 
>defeated
> > and run out of China.
> > So that the clear task of Revolutionaries in Newark is to Elect Ras 
>Baraka
> > and Hector Corchado, not by copying the Opportunism of the bourgeois
> > candidates but putting out a clear Revolutionary Democratic Line. E.g.
> > DEMOCRACY & SELF DETERMINATION- 1END STATE TAKEOVER OF EDUCATION-
> > 2RESTORE NEWARK CITIZENS RIGHT TO SPEAK AT CITY COUNCIL MEETINGS-
>3COMMUNITY
> > CONTROL OF POLICE- 4REDUCE DRUGS AND CRIME BY MASSIVE CAMPAIGN FOR JOBS,
> > EDUCATION AND RECREATION- 5 TO MAKE NEWARK'S "RENAISSANCE" CITY WIDE
> > &-REBUILD THE ECONOMY - STRESS COOPERATION BETWEEN THE PEOPLE OF NEWARK,
> > CITY & STATE AND COUNTY GOVERNMENT, BIG AND SMALL BUSINESS, & 
>INSTITUTIONS
> > &C
> >
> > If the Political Line is clear & strong enough and distributed broadly
>with
> > the necessary outreach to the community , the grass roots and indigenous
> > people of Newark, Ras Baraka's Campaign, as well as the Baraka-Corchado
> > Black-Latino Unity ticket, will be successful. But the Campaign must be 
>an
> > example of Revolutionary Democratic Organization and Mobilization not 
>just
> > career building with the present campaign, but as a method of Organizing
>the
> > whole working class for the broader struggle against Imperialism &
>National
> > Oppression. Against War and Rising Fascism!
> > True Revolutionaries cannot turn their backs on the need to defeat the
>Right
> > Wing Assault. But certainly, Booker will be back in 2006, some analysts
> > think that is his real battlefield. That the present campaign is just
> > advertising for the real Armageddon, Booker's backers know that after 
>the
> > present Mayor is gone, the next candidate representing Newark's people
>might
> > be an actual Revolutionary.

Post ID:2719
Sender:"peoples campaign" <nbpc_2002@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-04-28 02:01:48
Subject:Re: Matthew - - UNITY & STRUGGLE  BULLETIN  - -  4 /19/02
Message:

i must express serious issue with matthew and U&S.
mistakes2000 can be turned into strengths 2002. people should read this to 
understand


-*-for those that make it through this message... the anti-republican bloc 
of the new brunswick peoples campaign was expelled in may, 2 weeks after the 
convention2000. we were thrown out by U&S among others & were only 
reinstated by our own efforts to organize in the community - which paid off 
in august of 2001, which is when we formally endorsed ras. U&S expelled the 
anti-republican bloc of the new brunswick peoples campaign2000 & didn't even 
criticize themselves until that position became impossible to reconcile with 
the anti-republican bloc's pressure for an U&S issue to be out for last 
year's March ON Trenton.-*-

i will begin with this section -

>Also, Dave should really be ashamed of this tactic of trying to use the
>negative emotions from a recent feud between Joe Smith and POP as an anchor
>to tie around Amiri Baraka's neck: "U&S [read: Amiri] must also be taxed
>with Joseph Smith's demands (don't try to disavow him, U&S!)" In what way
>should U&S be "taxed", Collector?

your tax is putting out the next U&S issue, or should we wait until after 
the election for that too!


>This is really cynical and actually
>repeats & intensifies the mistake that Joe has apparently made, which is
>while boasting to be "The Most Revolutionary Dude in the Hood" the actual
>result is sowing seeds of divisiveness (intented or not) at a critical time
>in the struggle for political power between a peoples' organization and
>tried-and-true revolutionaries *from* the hood.

1. what does "apparently" mean?

2. why are there quotes around "The Most Revolutionary Dude in the Hood"    
where is the origin of these
    words

(answers are expected in such an order so that the answer answers the 
question.
maybe begin each answer with the question, ie. " Apparently means...")

3. does U&S not understand that the "divisiveness" is already here? this 
conversation wouldn't be
    happening if NBPC didn't point out the fact that POP the organization is 
not working with the committee to
    elect baraka. how can U&S allow matthew to slander me - in an effort to 
lay the "seeds of divisiveness" at
    my feet???

^^^ 2 questions ^^^
now matthew will elaborate, let's pay very close attention.

>This last point is worth elaborating on, because the struggle is for
>political power ultimately.  It is worth noting how Amiri's line differs
>from Dave's *in practice*....In working to building Ras' City Council
>campaign (shit, in working to raise & build Ras!) Amiri, Amina, all those
>toiling on the campaign trail, are fighting for a step foward in advancing
>the Democratic Revolution and setting the stage for a future socialist
>transformation.  (and yes, use James--who is himself a co-opted product of
>Home Rule and the struggle for self-determination--as a shield to maneuver.
>absolutely.  To do otherwise is unintelligent).

when discussing politics with an educated voter -  "to do otherwise is 
unintelligent". ok
when discussing politics with a proclaimed revolutionary that puts forward a 
boycott position on the mayoral campaign of newark 2002, like 
hungerfraud/greens have done, "to do otherwise is nothing short of COUNTER 
REVOLUTIONARY." especially when said parties have resources like an 
organization of POP's ability.

>This as opposed to Dave's
>line which leads him to treat politics like religion where his clean hands
>won't be tainted by the impurities of the beast: where he ends up 
>supporting
>token campaigns that are pure, but doomed to failure--the people can't
>exploit contradictions in the ruling class because "there is *no democracy*
>until after the revolution!!"  Dave said it, it must be so.

attention U&S,
there is nothing "pure" about campaigns that are "doomed to failure", unless 
you are talking to a voter that ~ followed their heart ~ ... but if you are 
talking to proclaimed revolutionaries, "doomed to failure" political 
campaigns are what we need to ABANDONED IMMEDIATELY!!!!!!!!!!!
and that it is the "doomed" campaign - that steal resources away from the 
local independent movement - which are the RAKES of divisiness. do you 
concure?
or does U&S really blame joe smith because the greens are backwards?


>To all the Greens and Nadir supporters who may be offended by this by
>implication: look around you and see what 15 months of Bush/Sharon has
>brought the world.  It is entirely necessary to learn from--& not
>repeat--the mistakes of 2000 national elections.

it is entirely necessary to learn from--& not repeat--the mistakes of 2000 
national elections
^^this should be on bumper stickers across the nation^^

>The point is not-and never
>was-how strong or weak Gore's candidacy was.  And to have been "let down" 
>by
>his weaknesses only betrays secret hope that the democrats might represent
>your interests....The point--which U&S among many others made relentlessly
>pre-2000 election--is that we needed desperately to hold back what
>Bush/Cheney obviously represented: the seizing of national power by
>Far-Right/American Fascist/Oil-Fueled madness & all out War to make the 
>Arab
>world an oil plantation, which we see unfolding in all its devestating fury
>by the minute; to exploit the contradictions in the ruling class.

it is an entire lie for U&S to allow matthew to state - "The point--U&S 
among others made relentlessly pre-2000 election--is that we needed 
desperately to hold back what bush/cheney..."

1. there was no U&S pre-2000 election. matthew will rescind this statement & 
he will admit that U&S did
    not go to print because it sat in his computer. why? because U&S made an 
alliance with local
    republicans&greens down in new brunswick. keith joseph, along w/ matt an 
editor of U&S, was a nbpc
    candidate for council that registered with the republican party along 
with the majority of nbpc members in
    exchange for all the fruits that come to those that register republican.

2. there was no U&S pre-2000 election. amiri will rescind this statement 
made by matthew & he will admit
    that U&S did not go to print because it sat in matthew's computer. why? 
because how could U&S attack
    bush&nadir in a national election and get republicans&greens to support 
keith joseph's/nbpc city council
    campaign at the same time?

3. U&S is just as responsible for bush2 as the greens. they are coming to 
realize this more and more by
     the minute. & it was more cripiling to the local movement the way they 
did it.

4. there is a history of U&S and the lack of publication during election 
campaigns. and this history
    continues -- FOR EXAMPLE, THERE IS CURRENTLY NO U&S NEWSPAPERS, YET 
THERE IS AN
    ELECTION.

>To
>continue to argue in defense of Nadir's ill-advised presidential campaign 
>at
>this time is absurd, and really the result of middle class delusions that
>you can "Run the system better" as Ralph himself said, even recently on
>'Hardcopy' (across from his "friend" Buchanon!!).  Again, the difference in
>lines with Baraka, and what I embrace, is the model of struggling for
>political power & self-determination from the ground up: the model today is
>Ras Baraka's campaign for revolutionary democracy.

for matthew to be doing anything before putting out a new issue of U&S is 
just as absurd.


>With that, I look foward to seeing many POP members out on the campaign
>trail between now and May 14, & I trust that many that I do not see are
>working in their own way to spread the word, and bring out the vote.
>This one's for real!

i would love to see the organization of POP working with the committee to 
elect ras baraka  & pushing back the march on trenton. i expect all 
supporters of ras & revolutionaries in POP will embrace this proposal. -joe

>In Unity & Struggle, Matthew Smith
>
>
>----Original Message Follows----
>From: "David Hungerford" <dbh@...>
>Reply-To: poprogress@yahoogroups.com
>To: <poprogress@yahoogroups.com>
>Subject: Re: [poprogress] special delivery - - UNITY & STRUGGLE �BULLETIN 
>�-
>-��4 /19/02
>Date: Fri, 26 Apr 2002 21:41:48 -0700
>
>Adherents of the Democrats are free to say what they want about their 
>party.
>What they may not do is claim their devotion to it amounts to Marxism.
>
>Let us look at U&S' statement, "The Trojan Horse," about this year's Newark
>municipal election. It begins with this:
>
>Communists & REVOLUTIONARY DEMOCRATS understand that there can be no
>socialist revolution without the completion of the Democratic Revolution.
>(See Lenin, Mao)"
>
>The more important thing is unsaid: there is no democracy for the working
>class and the oppressed nationalities without revolution. (That was what
>Lenin and Mao were about.) The posture of democracy first, then socialism,
>is consistent throughout. It amounts to reformism, not Marxism.
>
>The antics of "Black & Latino Bourgeois Democratic politicians" in New York
>and Los Angeles are described as "betrayal" of the principle of 
>Black-Latino
>unity. They're not betraying their bourgeois "principles" of anything. The
>principle of multinational unity only has meaning for the oppressed on a
>working class basis. Nowhere in this piece is the class content of the
>principle explained.
>
>A list of Cory Booker's sins is described to prove he is--a Republican! The
>problem is that everything on the list is typical as well of Democrats,
>like, um . . . Cory Booker. The real Trojan horse against the people isn't
>just Booker, it's the whole Democratic Party. Sharpe James is also a
>Democrat. Why is he an alternative?
>
>The paper's assessment of Sharpe is accurate enough. The difference comes
>down to his wispy national bourgeois aspects. These mean absolutely nothing
>without the political self-activity of the masses. To put this unwarranted
>emphasis on James is outright subjection to bourgeois leadership. U&S must
>also be taxed with Joseph Smith's demands (don't try to disavow him, U&S!)
>that other groups should drop their own activities, like the May 15
>Statewide March Against Police Brutality, in favor of Newark election
>activity.
>
>The piece supports Ras Baraka's campaign. That is a different matter from
>James. A comparison is made with the united front against Japanese
>imperialism of the Communist Party of China and the Kuomintang party of the
>landlords and capitalists. The problem here is the piece doesn't justify 
>the
>comparison. (Mao said political power grows out of the barrel of a gun.
>That's exactly how the Communists later ran the Kuomintang out of
>continental China.)
>
>A number of "revolutionary democratic" program points are put forth. They
>are only revolutionary if put forth as class struggle. For example, the
>program of community control of the police is only revolutionary if aimed 
>at
>ending the armed rule of the bourgeoisie over the ruling class.
>
>Even so, no democratic program is in and of itself revolutionary. The
>democratic program is necessary to revolution, but not sufficient. The
>bourgeois state can never be overthrow by purely democratic means. To 
>forget
>this is to forget Marxism and fall into reformism.
>
>Nowhere does the paper's discussion of mass organization go beyond
>bourgeois-legal means. Most importantly, the need for a new and genuine
>Communist Party to lead the working class and the oppressed to proletarian
>revolution is ignored.
>
>Although this piece on its own makes almost no case for Ras, I hope to see
>him elected. Neither the stifling 1970 Old Guard nor the downtown/Booker 
>New
>Guard have anything to offer the great majority of Newark's residents. Ras
>will bring a new voice, he will raise considerable interest in the
>community. The only real test of what he can do with a seat on the Council
>will be what happens when he gets one.
>
>
>
>----- Original Message -----
>From: "peoples campaign" <nbpc_2002@...>
>To: <poprogress@yahoogroups.com>
>Sent: Thursday, April 25, 2002 9:35 PM
>Subject: [poprogress] special delivery - - UNITY & STRUGGLE  BULLETIN  - -
>4 /19/02
>
>
>  >
>  > UNITY & STRUGGLE BULLETIN 4 /19/02
>  >
>  >
>  > The Trojan Horse
>  >
>  > Communists & REVOLUTIONARY DEMOCRATS understand that there can be
>  > no socialist revolution without the completion of the Democratic
>Revolution.
>  > (See Lenin, Mao). They also know that the Revolutionaries must take the
>lead
>  > in the completion of a Democratic Revolution and even when utilizing 
>the
>  > bourgeois instrument of Electoral Politics, must use it to forward the
>  > themes, the political lines, the ideological clarity of the 
>revolutionary
>  > leaders of the Working Class.
>  > For these reasons Revolutionaries running in bourgeois elections never
>  > consider Only their own candidacy, but take in to consideration the
>critical
>  > needs and issues of the working class. If they narrow their view to
>consider
>  > Only their own election to a seat, and do not put out the issues and
>themes
>  > that affect the whole working class, then they have become somewhat
>  > politically retarded so that their "insurgency" is reduced to the 
>narrow
>  > career considerations of the petty bourgeois democrat !
>  > In the Newark elections of May 14, Ras Baraka and in the alliance with
>the
>  > Puerto Rican north ward candidate, Hector Corchado, are without a doubt
>the
>  > most progressive force in the election. The very political strength and
>  > democratic leadership that their alliance has projected "Black-Latino
>Unity"
>  > draws the entire mass base of the grassroots constituency together, in
>  > defiance of the bogus "teams" both mayoral candidates have projected
>which
>  > excludes both Baraka and Corchado.
>  > This theme is especially relevant and necessary because of the 
>betrayals
>to
>  > this unity which were demonstrated in the New York City and Los Angeles
>  > Mayoral contests where Black & Latino Bourgeois Democratic politicians
>  > sabotaged that unity so that both Latino Mayoral candidates were 
>defeated
>  > and so called "moderate" whites were elected. Bloomberg in NYC spent 59
>  > million and bought colored quislings on the spot. Hahn in LA using the
>beard
>  > of his father's bravery in meeting Dr. King at the airport, and his 
>palm
>  > greasing of Negro politicians, zig zagged his way into office, and upon
>  > being elected immediately announced that he was firing the Black Police
>  > Chief. Now the Negroes are whining, betrayal. But it was their betrayal
>  > which allowed Hahn's.
>  > In Newark, some people believe that as long as they vote for RAS BARAKA
>and
>  > HECTOR CORCHADO, they have fulfilled their progressive obligations so
>that
>  > they can covertly vote for the Wall St Trojan Horse, Corey Booker. But
>this
>  > is simply a failure to closely examine and analyze the entire meaning 
>of
>  > this campaign.
>  > On one hand you have Sharpe James, in public office since the 
>Community's
>  > Choice Campaign of 1970. He is part of the Afro American National
>  > Bourgeoisie. Always compromising with Corporate Capital, usually shaky 
>in
>  > confronting the big dogs of government and business. an important
>operative
>  > in the Democratic Party, usually self hypnotized by the beauties of his
>ego,
>  > never completely honest, manipulative, capable of any trick, betrayal,
>scam
>  > one can think of.
>  > Yet he is the national bourgeoisie, as shaky as Chiang Kai Chek, and on
>site
>  > representative of the self promoting Tonto politics of the 
>congressional
>  > black caucus, though there are a few exceptions. But the National
>  > Bourgeoisie for all its weak wavering dishonest compromise is a flawed
>but
>  > actual representative of "Home Rule", a very weak example of this 
>city's
>  > Self Determination. That it is so weak must also raise questions of the
>  > weakness of Newark's would be revolutionaries.
>  > Corey Booker, on the other hand, is a Comprador, straight out. He has
>raised
>  > earlier, 795,000 from Wall St. (See Star Ledger, NYTimes) and another
>  > 400,000 from New Jersey suburbs! Now that figure is nearly three 
>million
>  > dollars! Including contributions from Goldman- Sachs Brokerage, Jack
>Kemp,
>  > the National Republican party, &C . With over One Million dollars 
>raised
>  > from Outside Newark,
>  > It indicates that those are his true sponsors and backers.
>  > In addition, Booker is an active Republican. Yes, the Republicans of
>Bush,
>  > Ashcroft, Thomas, Whitman, budget cuts, tax rebates to the 
>corporations,
>  > Enron, World Trade Center suspiciousness, Afghanistan, Enablers of
>Sharon's
>  > Massacre Crusade of the Palestinians, Spy plane over China, Confederate
>  > Flag, Environmental Terror, Right wing election crooks, &c &C
>  > Booker escorted Bush 2's Spouse Laura, Republican Senate Candidate Bob
>  > Franks and the super rightist Gubernatorial candidate Bret Schundler
>through
>  > Newark. Booker backs Privatization, Charter Schools, the general
>Republican
>  > anti -working class anti -minority anti -immigrant , pro corpora-e
>Agenda.
>  > He is quite simply a Trojan horse for the Republican initiative to take
>  > Newark, now that they have been kicked out of Trenton.
>  > For the people of Newark, a Republican victory would mean the 
>Destruction
>of
>  > the Public School System, The Privatization of the businesses and
>resources
>  > that will come from the building of the Arena, the privatization of the
>  > entire so called Newark Renaissance. Ironically, when Booker claims to 
>be
>  > calling for the benefits of this renaissance to be spread among the 
>whole
>  > Newark Community not just for Downtown. We must realize Booker Is
>Downtown.
>  > A representative of Corporate Republican Interests . They are his
>Sponsors,
>  > not the people of Newark!
>  > If Booker's Economic base is Right Wing Corporate , his social base is
>the
>  > suburban Yuppies and Buppies who form the majority of his staff. His
>triumph
>  > would mean the Elimination of 16,000 jobs from the City Hall Infra
>structure
>  > and staffs. These jobs would then be refilled by the suburban white
>Yuppie
>  > and Buppie Negro contingent, already easing in with NJPAC, and city
>hall's
>  > offices would become almost instantly "foreign" i.e., the other part of
>the
>  > middle management largely white college crowd who will also be the 
>staff
>  > for the new businesses coming into the city. The young folks who the 
>new
>  > downtown condominiums are being built!
>  > It is as simple as Home Rule Vs Foreign Domination. Self Determination 
>Vs
>  > Corporate Rule! Mao made a United Front with Chiang Kai Chek's 
>Kuomintang
>  > against the Japanese Imperialists, but when the Japanese were defeated
>  > Chiang tried to destroy the Revolutionaries led by Mao , but were
>defeated
>  > and run out of China.
>  > So that the clear task of Revolutionaries in Newark is to Elect Ras
>Baraka
>  > and Hector Corchado, not by copying the Opportunism of the bourgeois
>  > candidates but putting out a clear Revolutionary Democratic Line. E.g.
>  > DEMOCRACY & SELF DETERMINATION- 1END STATE TAKEOVER OF EDUCATION-
>  > 2RESTORE NEWARK CITIZENS RIGHT TO SPEAK AT CITY COUNCIL MEETINGS-
>3COMMUNITY
>  > CONTROL OF POLICE- 4REDUCE DRUGS AND CRIME BY MASSIVE CAMPAIGN FOR 
>JOBS,
>  > EDUCATION AND RECREATION- 5 TO MAKE NEWARK'S "RENAISSANCE" CITY WIDE
>  > &-REBUILD THE ECONOMY - STRESS COOPERATION BETWEEN THE PEOPLE OF 
>NEWARK,
>  > CITY & STATE AND COUNTY GOVERNMENT, BIG AND SMALL BUSINESS, &
>INSTITUTIONS
>  > &C
>  >
>  > If the Political Line is clear & strong enough and distributed broadly
>with
>  > the necessary outreach to the community , the grass roots and 
>indigenous
>  > people of Newark, Ras Baraka's Campaign, as well as the Baraka-Corchado
>  > Black-Latino Unity ticket, will be successful. But the Campaign must be
>an
>  > example of Revolutionary Democratic Organization and Mobilization not
>just
>  > career building with the present campaign, but as a method of 
>Organizing
>the
>  > whole working class for the broader struggle against Imperialism &
>National
>  > Oppression. Against War and Rising Fascism!
>  > True Revolutionaries cannot turn their backs on the need to defeat the
>Right
>  > Wing Assault. But certainly, Booker will be back in 2006, some analysts
>  > think that is his real battlefield. That the present campaign is just
>  > advertising for the real Armageddon, Booker's backers know that after 
>the
>  > present Mayor is gone, the next candidate representing Newark's people
>might
>  > be an actual Revolutionary.
>  >

>not

>from the dogmatists as possible.

Post ID:2724
Sender:"benjamin ramos" <uriyoan@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-04-28 23:32:44
Subject:Antonio Camacho Negron May 20th
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is sending this email to the many political 
organizations and campaigns that have worked with us in the past to ask for 
an endorsement of our May 20th Reception for Antonio Camacho Negron (one of 
our freed Puerto Rican Political Prisoners) and to invite the greater 
movement along to this powerful reception/celebration!!

Antonio Camacho Negron will be in New York  one night before he returns to 
Puerto Rico (he has denied Parole conditions and is going back to Puerto 
Rico to lead a protest against the colonial government).

Join for us for FOOD, LIVE PERFORMANCES BY MARIPOSA, THE WELFARE POETS, 
YARISA COLON AND OTHERS, MUSIC AND COME HEAR ANTONIO CAMACHO NEGRON SPEAK!!

The reception/celebration will take place on:

MONDAY MAY 20TH, 2002 AT 6:30PM
ST. MARY'S EPISCOPAL CHURCH
521 W126TH ST. (BETWEEN BROADWAY AND AMSTERDAM AVENUE)
Take the 1 or 9 train to w125th St. and Broadway

To endorse this activity please email ProLibertad@...

***If you are interested in sending Antonio some money for his travel costs 
and for general pocket money (which he seriously needs) then please send 
your tax deductible donation to:

IFCO/PROLIBERTAD FOR ANTONIO CAMACHO NEGRON
402 W145TH ST.
NY, NY 10031


_________________________________________________________________

Post ID:2726
Sender:"Charlotte L. Kates" <ckates@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-04-29 09:13:49
Subject:ALL DOUGLASS WOMEN: VOTE KELLY BRENNAN TODAY!
Message:

Our last election for DCGA ended in a TIE for the position of Internal Vice
President! This illustrates ever more strongly that it is *vital* that
people turn out today to vote Kelly Brennan for Internal Vice President!
Polls are open at the Douglass College Center between 10 AM and 4 PM. Stop
by and cast your vote; one vote does make a difference!

Kelly Brennan is the DOUGLASS UNITED candidate for Internal Vice President.
She is committed to the Douglass United platform--fighting the budget cuts,
smashing all forms of oppression, valuing the traditions of Douglass
College, standing up for women's services, and struggling for student
democracy. As Class of 2005 president, she has worked in her class and in
DCGA to rectify women's body image issues on campus, and has refounded
CURVES (Combatting Un-Realistic Views of Eating and Size); she has, as a
member of the Presidential Search Action Committee, been actively involved
in standing for a strong student representation in the upcoming search for a
Rutgers University president. In addition, Kelly has taken a leading role in
fighting privatization at the University and in building a student-labor
alliance with maintenance and custodial workers. She has consistently
represented the interests of students with dedication and passion, and she
will bring this commitment to the position of Internal Vice President.

Vote Kelly Brennan!
Douglass United
Internal Vice President
TODAY, Monday, April 29
Douglass College Center
10 AM - 4 PM

-Charlotte
http://douglassunited.pathbot.com/
                              Charlotte L. Kates
  ckates@... ** ckates@...
 http://www.ruwomenscenter.org/  ** http://www.offlines.org
Practice organized resistance and conscious acts of solidarity!





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:2727
Sender:"Charlotte L. Kates" <ckates@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-04-29 18:02:53
Subject:RALLY AGAINST THE BUDGET CUTS! FOR AFFORDABLE EDUCATION!
Message:

Tomorrow, at 2:30 PM, on the steps of Brower Commons, the associated
Student Governing Associations of Rutgers--DCGA, LCGA, RCGA and CCC--will
sponsor a rally for affordable education and against the budget cuts. As
students at a public state university, we recognize the importance of the
mission of the public university--affordable, accessible, high-quality
education available to all. The university exists--or should exist--as a
resource for the people of the state, and must be valued as such. Instead,
however, it has come under attack--budgets repeatedly slashed and calls
for additional funding going unanswered as enrollment continues to
rise. We must make our voices heard! Tell Trenton that higher education
matters--

Tuesday, April 30
2:30 PM
Brower Commons
College Avenue Campus

Subject:Jose Solis Jordan Update!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign  is proud to forward this English 
translation (by Frank Velgara) of this recent Claridad article on Jose Solis 
Jordan's upcoming move to Puerto Rico and eventual release from prison by 
the end of this year!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad@...
http://www.ProLibertad.org
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
_______________________________________________________________________
Claridad Newspaper, April 19, 2002
By Carmelo Ruiz Marrero

University Professor Jose Solis Jordan, jailed by Federal authorities since 
1999 for allegedly being a terrorist, will be transfered to the Federal 
Prison in Guaynabo, Puerto Rico, by the end of April, according to 
information received from his wife Marta Gonzalez.  It is expected that on 
July 23, 2002, he will be released to a halfway house in Trujillo Alto, and 
that we will complete his sentence in November at which time he will be 
released to the community at large.

Solis Jordan, who taught at the Education Department of the Rio Piedras 
campus of the University of Puerto Rico, was found guilty by a federal jury 
on March 12, 1999, for allegedly placing a bomb outside an army recruitment 
center in Chicago in December of 1992. No one was killed or wounded in that 
blast.  At that time, Solis Jordan was working as a professor at the 
University of DePaul and was doing volunteer work at the Corretjer Puerto 
Rican Cultural Center, both also in Chicago.

Rafael Marrero, infiltrator and provacteur

The star witness of federal proesecutors was the undercover infiltrator and 
agent provacateur Rafale Marrero, who admitted during the trial to having 
placed the bomb in question and to having recieved immunity in addition to 
$119,000 dollars for his services for the F.B.I. Besides Marrero's testimony 
and the allegations of the F.B.I., prosecutors did not present any other 
evidence to substantiate their case.  It was the word of honor of the F.B.I. 
and that of one of its informants against the word of a Puerto Rican 
independentista accused of bombing a federal building.  The jury, that did 
not have even one Latino in it, and whose Chairwomen was an employee of the 
Justice Department, believed federal prosecutors.

Marrero was not an unknown to the independence movement or to the Puerto 
Rican community in Chicago. This individual made his "entrance" on the 
political scence in Puerto Rico during the 1980's, when he became a member 
of the Anti-Electoral Front where he worked to create divisions and internal 
conflicts.

A the end of the 1980's, Marrero, moved to Chicago, where he became active 
in the Puerto Rican community and gained the trust of the staff at the 
Corretjer Cultural Center. He agressively sought to become friends with the 
family and friends of the Puerto Rican political prisoners.  He then married 
Evelyn odriguez, sister of then political prisoners Ida Luz and Alicia 
Rodriguez.  He had a child with Evelyn Rodriguez who he named Alicia Luz in 
honor of the baby's two aunts.

At the Cultural Center, Marrero began to plant and promote discord amogn the 
staff,assumed ultra-leftist and hardline positions, as he tried to instigate 
his comrades to commit acts of violence. Marrero also begin a campaign to 
discredit Jose Lopez, Director of that institution.

It was at this time that Jose Solis Jordan and Marrero met, given that their 
wives were close friends.  In 1995 Solis Jordan and his family returned to 
Puerto Rico. In the meantime, Marrero "transformed" himself from an ultra 
sectarian revolutionary to a attack dog and enemy of anything that was done 
and said by the independence movement.

At that time, Marrero began to publish and distribute El Pito, a defamatory 
newsletter dedicated to slander the Puerto Rican community and its leaders, 
especially targetting Jose Lopez and U.S. Congressman Luis Gutierrez 
(D-Chicago).  The financial backers and supporters of El Pito, were the 
developers and real estate interests that sought to sell block by block the 
Puerto Rican community in Chicago to right whites.  Among these developers 
and realtors was Gloria Chevere, who has close ties to Carlos Romero 
Barcelo.

Political Intrigue

According to Jose Lopez and his collegues at the Cultural Center, Chevere 
and Romero Barcelo have channeled funds which in part have come from the 
financial backers of the PNP prostatehood party in Puerto rico, in order to 
finance the election campaigns of Congressman Gutierrez' opponents. Romero 
detests Gutierrez not only because he (Gutierrez) is an Independentista but 
alos because of his friendly ties to the Popular Democratic Party of Puerto 
Rico and because Gutierrez torpedoed the Young Bill in 1998.

In addition to using the El Pito newsletter as a anti-Puerto Rican platform, 
Marrero served as a source for a series of sensationalist articles that 
appeared in February of 1997 in the Chicago daily newspaper the Sun Times.  
In these articles it was alleged that in the Roberto Clemente School,in the 
Puerto Rican Community and affiliated to the Corretjer Cultural Center, 
students were indoctrinated with pro-independentista ideas and that some of 
its teachers were members of the FALN (Amed Forces for National 
Liberation,in English).

These "reports" motivated the State Legislature of Illinois to launch an 
investigation of the Roberto Clemente School, which was led by right-wing 
Representative Edgar Lopez, a declared enemy of the independence movement 
and of Luis Gutierrez.

The star witness of this investigation was none other than Marrero, who 
testified before legislators that the Clemente School was a hideout and den 
of terrorists and that the school was chanelling and using State and Federal 
funds to finance pro-independence propaganda and to support the campaign to 
free the Puerto Rican political prisoners.
But the investigation which was described by the Puerto Rican Community as a 
McCarthyist witch hunt, did not find evidence of even one illegal action at 
the Clemente School or the Puerto Rican Cultural Center

Imprisoned, but not defeated

Of the time that Solis Jordan was in jail the first few months were the 
worst because it was during this time that he was subjected to countless 
humiliations and indignities.  He was held for various weeks at the state 
peneteniary in Peoria, forced to sleep on the floor of a cell that was 
infested with rodens and was later transferred to the Federal Peniteniary in 
Coleman, Florida, where he is imprisoned today.  His first three weeks at 
Coleman were spent in solitary confinement and in chains 23 hours a day.

Once he was in general population at Coleman, he did not resort to cursing 
his bad luck, nor did he resign himself to the stuation, he kept busy by 
developing new projects and helping his fellow inmates.  Solis Jordan is 
presently giving G.E.D. Classes to other prisoners.  At first, the prison 
authorities assign to him about a dozen "troublemakers" or "incorregibles" 
to see what would happen.  After a few weeks, his classes were filled to 
capacity as more and more inmates wanted to participate in his classes.

In addition to lending a helping hand to any prisoner that requested it, 
often for things such as how to write a letter or to know their rights, he 
also is writing a book about investigative methodologies.

Solis is the father of 5 children.  Three of them are children of a previous 
marriage of his wifes, whose first husband died in a tragic accident.




_________________________________________________________________
Chat with friends online, try MSN Messenger: http://messenger.msn.com

translation (by Frank Velgara) of this recent Claridad article on Jose Solis 
Jordan's upcoming move to Puerto Rico and eventual release from prison by 
the end of this year!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign

Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244

Claridad Newspaper, April 19, 2002
By Carmelo Ruiz Marrero

University Professor Jose Solis Jordan, jailed by Federal authorities since 
1999 for allegedly being a terrorist, will be transfered to the Federal 
Prison in Guaynabo, Puerto Rico, by the end of April, according to

Barcelo.

financial backers of the PNP prostatehood party in Puerto rico, in order to

detests Gutierrez not only because he (Gutierrez) is an Independentista but 
alos because of his friendly ties to the Popular Democratic Party of Puerto 
Rico and because Gutierrez torpedoed the Young Bill in 1998.

These "reports" motivated the State Legislature of Illinois to launch an

But the investigation which was described by the Puerto Rican Community as a

>caellian@yahoogroups.com, w_d_c@yahoogroups.com, heydcga@yahoogroups.com, 
>nb-solidarity@yahoogroups.com, nbpeoplescampaign@yahoogroups.com, 
>redcollective@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [nbpc] RALLY AGAINST THE BUDGET CUTS! FOR AFFORDABLE EDUCATION!
>Date: Mon, 29 Apr 2002 18:02:53 -0400 (EDT)
>
>Today, at 2:30 PM, on the steps of Brower Commons, the associated
>Student Governing Associations of Rutgers--DCGA, LCGA, RCGA and CCC--will
>sponsor a rally for affordable education and against the budget cuts. As
>students at a public state university, we recognize the importance of the
>mission of the public university--affordable, accessible, high-quality
>education available to all. The university exists--or should exist--as a
>resource for the people of the state, and must be valued as such. Instead,
>however, it has come under attack--budgets repeatedly slashed and calls
>for additional funding going unanswered as enrollment continues to
>rise. We must make our voices heard! Tell Trenton that higher education
>matters--
>
>Tuesday, April 30
>2:30 PM
>Brower Commons
>College Avenue Campus
>

Post Date/Time:2002-05-01 10:50:18
Subject:May 20th Antonio Camacho Negron!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is sending this email to the many political 
organizations and campaigns that have worked with us in the past to ask for 
an endorsement of our May 20th Reception for Antonio Camacho Negron (one of 
our freed Puerto Rican Political Prisoners) and to invite the greater 
movement along to this powerful reception/celebration!!

Antonio Camacho Negron will be in New York  one night before he returns to 
Puerto Rico (he has denied Parole conditions and is going back to Puerto 
Rico to lead a protest against the colonial government).

Join for us for FOOD, LIVE PERFORMANCES BY MARIPOSA, THE WELFARE POETS,
YARISA COLON AND OTHERS, MUSIC AND COME HEAR ANTONIO CAMACHO NEGRON SPEAK!!

The reception/celebration will take place on:

MONDAY MAY 20TH, 2002 AT 6:30PM
ST. MARY'S EPISCOPAL CHURCH
521 W126TH ST. (BETWEEN BROADWAY AND AMSTERDAM AVENUE)
Take the 1 or 9 train to w125th St. and Broadway

To endorse this activity please email ProLibertad@...

***If you are interested in sending Antonio some money for his travel costs 
and for general pocket money (which he seriously needs) then please send 
your tax deductible donation to:

IFCO/PROLIBERTAD FOR ANTONIO CAMACHO NEGRON
402 W145TH ST.
NY, NY 10031

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is sending this email to the many political 
organizations and campaigns that have worked with us in the past to ask for

Post ID:2741
Sender:can_bush@...
Post Date/Time:2002-05-05 18:50:07
Subject:NYTimes.com Article: Eight Inmates Die in Cells as Fire Races Through Jail
Message:

This article from NYTimes.com 
has been sent to you by can_bush@....





can_bush@...

/-------------------- advertisement -----------------------\


Enjoy new investment freedom!

Get the tools you need to successfully manage your portfolio
from Harrisdirect.  Start with award-winning research.  Then
add access to round-the-clock customer service from
Series-7 trained representatives.  Open an account today and
receive a $100 credit!

http://www.nytimes.com/ads/Harrisdirect.html

\----------------------------------------------------------/


Eight Inmates Die in Cells as Fire Races Through Jail

May 5, 2002 

By DAVID M. HALBFINGER


 

BAKERSVILLE, N.C., May 4 - Eight inmates were killed when a
cramped, outmoded jail here erupted in flames on Friday
night, billowing smoke so thick that rescuers were unable
even to unlock the prisoners' cells, the authorities said. 

The fire at the Mitchell County jail, here in the western
North Carolina hills not far from the Tennessee border,
also injured 13 people, including two sheriff's deputies
who crawled through the suffocating smoke, unlocked one
cell, and led eight inmates outside to safety. 

Sheriff Kenneth R. Fox said that state fire investigators
arrived today and had indicated that they believed the
fire, which burned for close to 90 minutes, had started
accidentally. He said it appeared to have started in a
brick and wood storage shed next to a small first-floor
holding cell used as a drunk tank. The shed held cleaning
equipment, wiring and a small electric heater, but the
sheriff said he did not believe the heater was in use at
the time. 

One inmate in that cell, Joey Grindstaff, 23, was killed,
Sheriff Fox said. The other seven men who died were trapped
in an upstairs cell. Mr. Grindstaff had been arrested on
Thursday or Friday after leading officers on a chase, the
sheriff said. 

Sheriff Fox said that although at least one of the dead,
who were aged 20 to 46, was awaiting trial on felony
charges, most were in on minor charges, and he described
several as "good boys." He said he was unable to provide
the exact charges most of the dead had been facing, their
addresses or survivors. 

One victim, Mark Thomas, 20, was serving a minor sentence -
the sheriff said he believed it was for driving while
intoxicated or a lesser offense - on weekends only, and was
to receive his high-school equivalency diploma next
weekend, Sheriff Fox said. 

The sheriff said he had attended high school with Mr.
Thomas's father, but that he had not yet spoken to any of
the victims' families. 

"You don't know what to say to them," he said. 

Residents
of this town of 500, which is an hour's drive north of
Asheville and home to miners, furniture makers and farmers,
said they could not remember anything so devastating. Even
the 1998 flood of the Cane Creek, which resulted in major
property damage, did not kill anyone, they said. 

"It just breaks your heart," said Kim Hoyle, 34, a former
jailer herself who said she knew most of the victims by
sight or better. "I just get cold chills when I think about
it. I just hope they all knew the Lord before they died." 

The two-story brick jail, connected to a 95-year-old
courthouse by a second-story walkway, was built in 1955
and, like many aging jails in this part of the state,
needed to be replaced, the sheriff said. Officials said it
had been cited for overcrowding as recently as 1997 when it
was used to hold up to 24 inmates, but it was housing 17
inmates on Friday. 

Inmates were allowed to smoke in their cells, but were not
included in regular fire drills, the sheriff said. "You
open a door on some and they'll be gone," he said. 

The jail had no sprinkler system. Cell windows were open to
let fresh air in, but acted like a chimney when the fire
broke out, the sheriff said. 

Though lights-out was not until midnight or 1 a.m., and an
intercom allowing the jailer to communicate with the
inmates was functioning, the jailer on duty did not hear
any shouts or commotion, the sheriff said. 

According to the sheriff's account, the jailer, Diane
Greene, was in an office with the lone female inmate,
Melissa Robinson, 30, who was also a trusty. The two
smelled smoke and Ms. Greene called 911 at 10:05 p.m. The
first firefighters and Deputy Chuck Vines Jr. arrived three
minutes later. 

Deputy Vines, 25, who is the son of Bakersville's mayor,
struggled to retain his composure as he described seeing
the rear of the jail in flames. He said he and a colleague,
Deputy Stacy Hughes, along with one of the first
firefighters on the scene, Mike Smith, all made their way
through the smoke to the first-floor cell. Deputy Hughes
had to race outside for fresh air, while Deputy Vines and
Mr. Smith escorted four conscious inmates outside. Four
others had to be carried out, he said. 

The smoke was so thick that rescuers could not climb the
jail's own stairs to the second floor, Deputy Vines said,
so he and Deputy Hughes tried to lead firefighters through
the courthouse to the jail's upper floor, where seven
inmates were trapped in a group cell. 

But the smoke and heat stopped them, he said. "Stacy and I
and the other firemen without their breathing apparatus
were having to find fresh air, quick," he said. All seven
inmates died. 

Besides Mr. Thomas and Mr. Grindstaff, the dead were:
Edmond Banks, 46; Danny Johnson, 42; Jesse Davis, 27;
Jeremiah Presnell, 20; Jason Boston, 27; and Tywain Neal,
28. 

Two of the surviving inmates were still in the hospital
this afternoon, two had been transferred to another jail,
and five had been released on bond. The jail will be closed
indefinitely. 

Rodney Burleson, 24, said he knew most of the inmates who
died. "Everybody went to the same high school, so everybody
knows who everybody is," he said. 

Mr. Burleson knew Mr. Boston, whose survivors included
three children, one an infant. He said Mr. Boston had been
given the choice between community service and three days
in jail, "and he took the days in jail." 

Joan Conley, the grandmother of Mr. Presnell, said he had
served two weeks of a 60-day sentence for repeatedly
driving without a license. "He never did get a license,
bless his heart," she said. 

Mrs. Conley said Mr. Presnell left behind two daughters,
ages 2 and 3. 

"He'd called me last week and talked to me on the phone,"
she said. "He said, `Mamaw, I just want to know if you're
all right.' I said, `I'm not doing too well.' But I said,
`I want you to get your life straightened out and live for
the Lord.' He said, `Don't you worry, soon as I get out of
here I'm going to be a different person.' 

"And he told me he loved me about three
times."

http://www.nytimes.com/2002/05/05/national/05JAIL.html?ex=1021639007&ei=1&en=2802a3cb3b76380d

or other creative advertising opportunities with The
New York Times on the Web, please contact
onlinesales@... or visit our online media
kit at http://www.nytimes.com/adinfo

For general information about NYTimes.com, write to 
help@....

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:2742
Sender:"joseph smith" <can_bush@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-05-05 21:36:44
Subject:RU search rules may be illegal
Message:

it should be the rutgers community that sets the platform and makes the 
final nod on the university president.




RU search rules may be illegal
Published in the Home News Tribune 5/05/02
By SARAH GREENBLATT
STAFF WRITER

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY:

A plan to keep the names of prospective Rutgers University presidents under 
wraps would violate the state's newly amended public-information laws, an 
expert on the statute said.

Those who are leading the search for a new Rutgers president said they plan 
to maintain confidentiality throughout the process of finding a successor 
for Francis L. Lawrence.

In launching the search last month, Board of Governors Chairman Gene O'Hara 
said the process should remain confidential, in order to attract highly 
qualified applicants.

Disclosure could cause candidates to lose interest, O'Hara said, since 
publicity has caused applicants for some top posts at universities to lose 
their jobs.

Search committee chairman John Colaizzi - dean of Rutgers' Ernest Mario 
School of Pharmacy - agreed.

"The caliber of candidates we try to attract would really dictate that the 
confidentiality be maintained throughout the entire process," Colaizzi said.

Many Rutgers professors contend the process should be less secretive, at 
least once the finalists are picked.

"I think it would be highly desirable for members of the university 
community other than the search committee to interact with those 
candidates," said chemistry Professor Martha Cotter, who chairs the 
Rutgers-New Brunswick Faculty Council.

The council has urged Colaizzi and the board to let professors and students 
meet the finalists and provide input before the appointment is made.

Without such input, English Professor William Dowling said, "the search 
committee is asking the university to buy a pig in a poke."

Lawrence's critics claim the search that led to his appointment in 1990 was 
flawed, in part because most professors and students didn't meet him until 
he was hired, and they never met his competition.

At the time, Rutgers was not legally obliged to identify the finalists, 
since state law only required disclosure of documents that universities and 
public agencies were statutorily required to keep.

But amendments to the public-records law that take effect July 8 will force 
Rutgers to release the resumes of applicants for university posts, according 
to Arlene M. Turinchak, an associate in the Somerset law firm, McGimpsey & 
Cafferty, which re-wrote the law.

The revised law defines most documents maintained by state agencies and 
universities as public records, Turinchak said.

Exceptions include students' admission records, test questions and certain 
materials related to academic research.

"There's nothing in here that would exempt resumes," she said.

Colaizzi, while conceding that he could not address the fine points of the 
law, disagreed.

"The university's position is that this policy of confidentiality in this 
particular search is consistent with the applicable state laws in New 
Jersey," he said.

Kim Manning-Lewis, acting executive director of university relations, said 
Rutgers' stance will serve the best interests of the institution and the 
state.

Rutgers is hardly alone in seeking to shield presidential applicants from 
publicity, said Marlene Ross, senior author of a report on university 
presidents issued in 2000 by the American Council of Education.

About 30 percent of public universities decline to identify candidates, Ross 
said.

"One of the reasons for not making the names public is that it undermines 
(the candidate's) credibility in their own institution," she said. 
"Obviously, only one person will get the presidency."

In Florida, where public universities must disclose the names of all 
presidential aspirants, she said, officials complain that they get a small 
pool of applicants.

Public universities in several states have faced lawsuits for withholding 
information on presidential candidates, according to an article that 
appeared in the Winter 2000 edition of the Journal of College and University 
Law.

As a result, the article said, legislators in Michigan, New Mexico and Texas 
enacted laws that protect public universities from disclosing the full list 
of applicants for presidential posts.

But in all three states, the laws require institutions to identify the 
finalists within a specified number of days before an appointment becomes 
final.

Colaizzi said publishing the names of finalists - some of whom would not get 
the job - would hamper Rutgers' search.

"That would really put them in an embarrassing situation in their home 
institution and would detract from their ability to lead at their home 
institution," he said. "My sense is that this would hurt us."

At least some presidential candidates who have been passed over for 
prestigious posts have recovered quite well.

Less than a year after being eliminated from contention for the top job at 
Harvard University, former University of Michigan President Lee Bollinger 
was hired in October to lead Columbia University.

According to the Chronicle of Higher Education, Bollinger walked away from 
an annual salary offer at Michigan of $700,000, which was slated to double 
the following year.


Sarah Greenblatt: (732) 565-7205; e-mail sgreenbl@...


from the Home News Tribune

Published: May 5, 2002




_________________________________________________________________
Get your FREE download of MSN Explorer at http://explorer.msn.com/intl.asp.

an annual salary offer at Michigan of $700,000, which was slated to double 
the following year.

you have contributed nothing.

questions & inquiry.

inquire about people & organizations like you fortunato & your organization.

>move
>for Ras.Nothing could be further from the truth. You have created a
>RELUCTANCE among people to get involved because many people mistakenly
>believe you speak for the campaign.

njgreens & that debby got her lawn sign. all of which happened after my

a better reason of why all support means that no njgreens even know who 
baraka is?

what am i splitting & wrecking? again, & slower this time... there is no 
relationship between pop, njgreens, fabw & the committee to elect ras 
baraka. my criticism is the result of an already living split. how can my 
comment on the fact that pop is doing nothing as an organization to elect 
ras baraka, be the cause of a split. my criticism wouldn't exist if pop was 
working with the committee to elect.

pop, njgreens, & fabw have done nothing to get baraka elected.  no voter 
registration. no marches or rallies. no fundraisers, dinners, or events. no 
phone bank or literature. & what's worst no coalition building, NO UNITED 
FRONT WORK!!
the njdemocrats have done more than nothing.

for fortunato to even bring cointelpro into this discussion demonstrates how 
desperate njgreens are.
when one's political arguement is defeated, reactionary approaches seize the 
day.

by fortunato telling me to go away must have one question who is creating 
splits. -jsmith

May 7, 2002 

By MARLISE SIMONS


Pim Fortuyn, a maverick right-wing populist who was a
leading candidate in national elections scheduled for next
week, was shot and killed on Monday.

Post ID:2748
Sender:can_bush@...

Subject:NYTimes.com Article: Enron Forced Up California Energy Prices, Documents Show
Message:

This article from NYTimes.com 
has been sent to you by can_bush@....


/-------------------- advertisement -----------------------\


Enjoy new investment freedom!

Get the tools you need to successfully manage your portfolio
from Harrisdirect.  Start with award-winning research.  Then
add access to round-the-clock customer service from
Series-7 trained representatives.  Open an account today and

\----------------------------------------------------------/


Enron Forced Up California Energy Prices, Documents Show

May 7, 2002 

By RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr. and JEFF GERTH


 

WASHINGTON, May 6 - Electricity traders at Enron drove up
prices during the California power crisis through
questionable techniques that company lawyers said "may have
contributed" to severe power shortages, according to
internal Enron documents released today by federal
regulators. 

Within Enron, the documents show, traders used strategies
code-named Fat Boy, Ricochet, Get Shorty, Load Shift and
Death Star to increase Enron's profits from trading power
in the state - techniques that added to electricity costs
and congestion on transmission lines. 

The documents - memorandums written in December 2000 by
lawyers at Enron to another lawyer at the company - also
describe "dummied-up" power-delivery schedules, the
submission of "false information" to the state, and the
effective increasing of costs to all market participants by
"knowingly increasing the congestion costs." 

The memos, which provide the first inside look at the
complex trading strategies Enron used in California, give
strong ammunition to state officials who have long argued
that Enron and other power marketers manipulated the
state's market and played a crucial role in the crisis that
cost California consumers and utilities tens of billions of
dollars in 2000 and 2001. The documents state that other
power companies used similar techniques. 

Tonight, Senator Dianne Feinstein, Democrat of California,
said she would ask Attorney General John Ashcroft "to
pursue a criminal investigation to determine whether in
fact federal fraud statutes or any other laws were
violated" by Enron's energy-trading activities. Federal
prosecutors are already conducting an inquiry into Enron's
accounting, which falsely increased reported profits but
ultimately led to the company's filing for bankruptcy
protection in December. 

Enron agreed to sell its energy-trading unit earlier this
year to UBS Warburg, a division of UBS, Switzerland's
largest bank. Nearly all of Enron's senior executives, and
most of its board members, have departed in the last nine
months. 

Enron's senior management learned of the documents in late
April, and the company's board decided during a meeting on
Sunday to waive attorney-client privilege and turn the
memos over to investigators at the Federal Energy
Regulatory Commission, a person close to the company said.
The company has also informed the Justice Department, the
Securities and Exchange Commission and the attorney general
of California about the documents. 

At a noon meeting today, lawyers for Enron gave the memos
to investigators from the regulatory commission, which is
examining whether Enron manipulated energy markets in the
West. The agency released the documents a few hours later.
Officials at the commission declined to comment, but they
are continuing their investigation into Enron's effect on
power prices and asked the company today to provide
additional documents on its electricity and natural-gas
trading activities. 

In a letter sent by officials at the commission today to
Enron, investigators at the agency said the documents
described how Enron traders were "creating, and then
`relieving,' phantom congestion" on California's
electricity grid. The documents also detail what
investigators described as "megawatt laundering," in which
Enron bought power in California, resold the power out of
the state and then bought the power back and resold it back
into California - allowing Enron to circumvent price caps
meant to clamp down on costs. 

"These documents prove that these companies can manipulate
the market," said Loretta Lynch, the president of the
California Public Utilities Commission. "Enron prevented
California from seeing these documents for years, and now
we know why." 

Ms. Lynch said the documents supported her argument that
FERC should leave in place temporary electricity price
restraints, introduced last June, which state officials say
have played a large role in reining in prices. "I don't see
how FERC can remove the boundaries they put in place on our
market last June." 

An outside lawyer for Enron, Robert S. Bennett, said he
could not comment on the trading strategies described in
the documents. "Because we have sold the trading unit and
the people with the knowledge of trading practices are no
longer with the company, we do not know what the true facts
are, and we do not know which parts of the memoranda are
correct and which parts are incorrect," Mr. Bennett said
tonight. 

But he emphasized that the company had agreed to waive that
attorney-client privilege because it was trying to
cooperate with the various investigations into Enron's
business practices. "These memoranda came to the attention
of the board and current management in late April, and the
board instructed its counsel to not assert the
attorney-client privilege and produce these documents to
the appropriate government entities," Mr. Bennett said. 

Another memo written by a separate group of lawyers for
Enron in 2001 - apparently in January or February, after
soaring wholesale power prices in California pushed the
state's largest utilities to the brink of insolvency -
tried to play down the strategies described in the December
2000 memos. 

In this later memo, which was written to prepare Enron for
the "various investigations and litigation" it faced
because of the California power crisis, the lawyers
repeatedly tried to play down or cast doubt on the
conclusions drawn by Enron's own lawyers in the earlier
memos. 

"Some of the information" in the earlier memos "which
resulted in some erroneous assumptions and conclusions,
cannot be supported by the facts and evidence which are now
known," the later memo stated. 

In one strategy described in the December 2000 memos, Enron
would buy power from a state-run exchange for $250 a
megawatt-hour - the maximum under the price caps - and
resell it outside California for almost five times as much.


"Thus, traders could buy power at $250 and sell it for
$1,200," according to one memo. In that document, the Enron
lawyers acknowledged that such activity could be playing a
big role in causing electricity shortages in the state, but
they suggested that was not a significant concern. 

"This strategy appears not to present any problems," the
memo stated, "other than a public relations risk arising
from the fact that such exports may have contributed to
California's declaration of a Stage 2 Emergency yesterday."


The Death Star strategy, as described in the memos, allowed
Enron to be paid "for moving energy to relieve congestion
without actually moving any energy or relieving any
congestion." 

And the Load Shift strategy allowed Enron to generate about
$30 million in profits in 2000 using techniques that,
according to the documents, included creating "the
appearance of congestion through the deliberate
overstatement" of power to be delivered. 

In the past, Enron officials said the California power
crisis was caused by the state's deeply flawed electricity
deregulation plan, the lack of new power-generation
capacity and by temporary factors, like a drought that
drastically reduced available hydropower. Even some
economists who think price manipulation was widespread say
these other factors contributed to soaring prices. 

But Enron executives always insisted that absolutely
nothing their traders had done contributed to the crisis.
In an interview last year, Enron's former chairman, Kenneth
L. Lay, dismissed accusations that manipulation was even
partly to blame for California's troubles. 

"Every time there's a shortage or a little bit of a price
spike, it's always collusion or conspiracy or something,"
Mr. Lay said in the interview, which was also taped for "
Frontline" on PBS. "I mean, it always makes people feel
better that way." 


http://www.nytimes.com/2002/05/07/business/07ENRO.html?ex=1021776314&ei=1&en=ce528533ba9be583

4 Arrested for Campaign Sign Removal

May 9, 2002
By THE NEW YORK TIMES 




 

NEWARK, May 8 - Four people, including a close aide to
Mayor Sharpe James, face criminal mischief charges for
removing campaign signs belonging to Mr. James's opponent
in Tuesday's election, the police said. 

The arrests were the latest episode in the bitter campaign
between Mr. James and Councilman Cory Booker, which has
been rife with allegations of dirty tricks. 

An unmarked police car was patrolling the city's North Ward
around 3 a.m. today when an officer saw four men removing
one of Mr. Booker's campaign signs from an oak tree near
312 Mount Prospect Avenue, the police said. 

The police arrested Danny Bass, 38; Laquan A. Dent, 29; and
William Miles, 37, all of Newark, and Malik Jones, 29, of
East Orange. Mr. Miles is a member of Mr. James's security
team. 

A van and a car belonging to the men were parked in the
street nearby. Inside the van, the police said, were other
Booker campaign signs that had been cut into pieces.

http://www.nytimes.com/2002/05/09/nyregion/09SIGN.html?ex=1021922612&ei=1&en=9b0361ff54e294cd

4 Arrested for Campaign Sign Removal

May 9, 2002
By THE NEW YORK TIMES 




 

NEWARK, May 8 - Four people, including a close aide to
Mayor Sharpe James, face criminal mischief charges for
removing campaign signs belonging to Mr. James's opponent
in Tuesday's election, the police said. 

The arrests were the latest episode in the bitter campaign
between Mr. James and Councilman Cory Booker, which has
been rife with allegations of dirty tricks. 

An unmarked police car was patrolling the city's North Ward
around 3 a.m. today when an officer saw four men removing
one of Mr. Booker's campaign signs from an oak tree near
312 Mount Prospect Avenue, the police said. 

The police arrested Danny Bass, 38; Laquan A. Dent, 29; and
William Miles, 37, all of Newark, and Malik Jones, 29, of
East Orange. Mr. Miles is a member of Mr. James's security
team. 

A van and a car belonging to the men were parked in the
street nearby. Inside the van, the police said, were other
Booker campaign signs that had been cut into pieces.

Post ID:2756
Sender:can_bush@...
Post Date/Time:2002-05-09 14:34:18
Subject:NYTimes.com Article: How Enron Got California to Buy Power It Didn't Need
Message:

This article from NYTimes.com 
has been sent to you by can_bush@....
