Post ID:2858
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-06-28 22:39:43
Subject:JOSE SOLIS JORDAN FOUND IN PR!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign have confirmed the whereabouts of our 
brother/political prisoner JOSE SOLIS JORDAN!!  According to both the Bureau 
of Prisons and the first had account of Pedro Colon Almenas, JOSE SOLIS 
JORDAN IS IN PUERTO RICO IN GUAYNABO MDC!!

For months now, Jose has been a victim of isolation; traveling from Florida 
(FCI Coleman) to Atlanta and then Oklahoma en route to Puerto Rico to finish 
the rest of his unjust sentence.  Throughout his traveling he has been 
isolated from people, put in the "hole", and has not had contact with 
friends, family and lawyers.

Please write to him and let him know that he is supported and send him some 
commissary!!

Jose Solis Jordan
#08-121424
GUAYNABO MDC
P.O. BOX 2147
SAN JUAN, RQ 00922-2147
_____________________________
The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad@...

Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
www.ProLibertad.org

Post ID:2863
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-07-04 16:16:31
Subject:Pedro Colon and Mumia Abu Jamal
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is launching a new campaign to raise money 
for Pedro Colon Almenas' mother, Gloria Almenas.  When Pedro was 
incarcerated his mother lost her only financial support.

Gloria is an elderly and ill woman.  She needs our support!!  Please send 
her a check or money order to:

Gloria Almenas
PO Box 30724
San Juan, PR 00929-1724
________________________________________________________________________

organizations to endorse our Freedom Challenge!! ProLibertad has committed 
itself to raise $10,000 for Mumia Abu Jamal's Legal Defense!!

ON SATURDAY AUGUST 24TH, 2002!!

Post ID:2864
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-07-05 15:53:11
Subject:Free the Cuban Five!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is solidarity with the struggle to free the 
Cuban Political Prisoners encourages people to write to them and snd them 
commissary.  If you are unaware of who they are and why they have been 
unjustly incarcerated, please check out the following sites.

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
ProLibertad@...
www.ProLibertad.org
Bronx 718-601-4751
Manhattan 212-927-9065
New Jersey 201-435-3244
________________________________________________________________________

Updated addresses for writing to the five Cuban revolutionaries

Five Cuban revolutionaries are serving 15 years to life in U.S.
prisons on frame-up conspiracy charges. There are three useful web
sites with extensive information in Spanish on their fight. They are:

www.granma.cubweb.cu; http://www.jrebelde.cubaweb.cu/inocentes/index.html;
www.perspectiva mundial.com.

Readers can also find material in English at: www.themilitant.com.


Ren� Gonz�lez Sehwerert, Reg. #58738-004, FCI McKean, P.O. Box 8000,
Bradford, Pennsylvania 16701

Antonio Guerrero Rodr�guez, Reg. #58741-004, USP Florence, P.O. Box
7500, Florence, Colorado 81226

Gerardo Hern�ndez (Manuel Viramontes), Reg. #58739-004, USP Lompoc,
3600 Guard Road., Lompoc, California 93436

Fernando Gonz�lez Llort (Rub�n Campa), Reg. #58733-004, FCI Oxford,
P.O. Box 1000, Oxford, Wisconsin 53952-0505

Ram�n Laba�ino Salazar (Luis Medina), Reg. #58734-004, USP Beaumont,
P.O. Box 26030, Beaumont, Texas 77720-6035

Post ID:2869
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-07-10 19:13:51
Subject:Freedom Picnic Fundraiser!!
Message:

Join ProLibertad on our annual Freedom Picnic to HighLand Pool in Ringwood, 
New Jersey.  This isn't your typical disgusting toilet-city pool; Highland 
Pools are made up of steam-fed chemical-free PONDS!!

Bring your swimming trunks, bring games and get ready for some serious rest, 
fun and great dialogue.  We will have educational Learning circles on Puerto 
Rico, Vieques and The Puerto Rican Political Prisoners!!

Join us for FOOD, FUN AND RELAXATION!!
Saturday July 20th, 2002
Meet at the corner of w179th St. and Broadway at 9am to catch one of our 
Freedom vans!!

Bring $20 for the transportation from NYC, entrance to HighLand Pools and 
our delicious Latin Food!!  To reserve a seat on one of our Freedom Vans 
call 718-601-4751 or email ProLibertad@...


_________________________________________________________________

Post ID:2875
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-07-22 12:34:20
Subject:JUly 25th and July 26th Activities
Message:

Stop racial profiling and police brutality!!!!!

THE JUSTICE COMMITTEE FOR SANTIAGO VILLANUEVAInvites the whole communityTO 
CELEBRATE THE LIFE OF A MAN WHO DIED IN THE HANDS OF THOSE WHOSE CIVIL DUTY 
WAS TO ASSIST HIM BENEFIT CONCERT

Justice4ChagoThursday, July 25th7:00 - 10:00 P.M.
CLUB TAMBORIL 2005 Amsterdam Avenue, 3rd floor corner of 159th street

JULY 25th IS THE DAY OGUN BALENYO AND ST. JAMES. IT WOULD HAVE BEEN CHAGO'S 
35TH BIRTHDAY. LET'S CELEBRATE IN HIS NAME IN A MEMORABLE EVENING OF 
HAPPINESS, HOPE, FAITH & DETERMINATION TO KEEP UP THE STRUGGLE UNTIL VICTORY

featuring
YERBA BUENA      SANDRA GARCIA RIVERA       WELFARE POETS  PA'LOMONTE    
CLAUDIO Y SUS GUEDESES     FRANCIA REYES    PALO MAYOR   LA 21 DIVISION   
DAGOBERTO LOPEZ-CO�O  ... AND MANY SURPRISES !!PALOS   BOMBA & PLENA  JAZZ   
HIPHOP   POETRY  SONGS OF FREEDOM  DANCES  MERENGUE  GAGA.....

SUGGESTED DONATION:  $5.00(The proceeds from this event will go to the 
Santiago Villanueva Benefit Fund c/o Alianza Dominicana, Inc. They will be 
utilized to cover for the costs of the justice campaign, and to wire money 
periodically to Chago's children in the Dominican Republic)
_______________________________________________________________________

***INVITACION / INVITATION***> > DINNER FUNDRAISER / CENA PARA RECAUDAR 
FONDOS> empanadas y vino tinto / empanadas and red wine>

"Radioemisora Mapuche - La Radio del Lautaro"> > The first independent and 
autonomous radio of the> Mapuche people, founded by the Xeg-Xeg Mapuche> 
Corporation / La primera radio independiente y> autonoma del Pueblo Mapuche 
fundada por la> Corporacion> Mapuche Xeg-Xeg.> > VIERNES 26 de JULIO, 2002 / 
FRIDAY 26th of JULY,> 2002> > 7:00PM> > LexPark Studio> 873 Broadway (18th 
and Broadway)> Suite 408> New York, NY*> > LUISA ANKAMIL, Artist and Mapuche 
woman will expose> fotos and folklore / Artista y mujer Mapuche> expondra> 
fotografias y folklor> > Poesia, arte, discusion, y presentacion de video /> 
poetry, art, discussion, and video presentation > > (*Train 4,5,6 to 14th 
St/Union Square, four blocks> North and one block West)> > Donation / 
Donacion : $20> > Sponsors: La Pena del Bronx, Corporacion Mapuche> Xeg-Xeg, 
Doctors for Global Health (DGH),> International Action Center (IAC), 
Marichiweu, Red> Indigena y Popular Nueva York.> > > Para Mas Informacion / 
For More Information:> > www.lapenadelbronx.com / 718-402-9411> > **Todo 
dinero recaudado llegara a la Radio del> Lautaro> /All collected monies will 
benefit the Radio> Lautaro.> cmxegxeg@... / Temuko, Chile

Post ID:2877
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-07-23 14:05:08
Subject:Bronx Puerto Rican Day Parade
Message:

Join the ProLibertad Freedom Campaign on Sunday August 4th, 2002 at 8am
for the Bronx Puerto Rican Day Parade!!

Every year ProLibertad organizes a contingent to this wonderful parade.  
Each year we hand out literature on The Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, 
Puerto Rico and Vieques!!

This year we are going to try to collect a thousand signatures for our new 
Freedom Petition!!  We need you to help us reach our goal!!

We need volunteers to help us leaflet, collect petitions and of COURSE TO 
MARCH IN THE FREEDOM CONTINGENT!!

If you are interested in joining the contingent please contact 
ProLibertad@... or call our Bronx Office 718-601-4751

JOIN US ON SUNDAY AUGUST 4TH,2002 AT 8AM
AT W174TH ST AND GRAND CONCOURSE
TAKE THE D TRAIN TO 174TH-175TH

Post ID:2879
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-07-24 17:06:23
Subject:Vieques Political Prisoners Need Help!!
Message:

Situation of Robert Rabin and Hiram Lozada in the Federal Prison,
Guaynabo, PR

On Thursday, July 18 around 6 PM, Prisoners for Peace in Vieques
Robert (Bob) Rabin and Attorney Hiram Lozada, President of the Human
Rights Committee of the Puerto Rico Lawyer's Guild, were transferred -
without any explanation or notice - from Unit 1A (minimum security)
to Unit 1B, which has more restrictions such as limiting visits to
one afternoon per week, only for immediate family members. Rabin has
been denied the right to make telephone calls - not even to his
mother, who resides in Boston. It should be noted that recently these
two men - who are completing sentences of six (Rabin) and four
(Lozada) months for the misdemeanor offence of entering the bombing
range in Vieques to halt the bombing last April - publicly denounced
a series of violations of the prisoners' rights. We call on all who
are committed to peace and human rights to communicate with the
prison, in order to express concern for the well-being of our
prisoners for peace in Vieques. Telephone calls and faxed letters may
be sent to the official in charge of prisoners' issues: Attorney Alma
L�pez, Tel:(787)749-4480; Fax:(787)775-7824.




_________________________________________________________________
Send and receive Hotmail on your mobile device: http://mobile.msn.com





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:2880
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-07-24 17:08:01
Subject:Vieques Political Prisoners need Help!!
Message:

Situation of Robert Rabin and Hiram Lozada in the Federal Prison,
Guaynabo, PR

On Thursday, July 18 around 6 PM, Prisoners for Peace in Vieques
Robert (Bob) Rabin and Attorney Hiram Lozada, President of the Human
Rights Committee of the Puerto Rico Lawyer's Guild, were transferred -
without any explanation or notice - from Unit 1A (minimum security)
to Unit 1B, which has more restrictions such as limiting visits to
one afternoon per week, only for immediate family members. Rabin has
been denied the right to make telephone calls - not even to his
mother, who resides in Boston. It should be noted that recently these
two men - who are completing sentences of six (Rabin) and four
(Lozada) months for the misdemeanor offence of entering the bombing
range in Vieques to halt the bombing last April - publicly denounced
a series of violations of the prisoners' rights. We call on all who
are committed to peace and human rights to communicate with the
prison, in order to express concern for the well-being of our
prisoners for peace in Vieques. Telephone calls and faxed letters may
be sent to the official in charge of prisoners' issues: Attorney Alma
L�pez, Tel:(787)749-4480; Fax:(787)775-7824.






_________________________________________________________________
Send and receive Hotmail on your mobile device: http://mobile.msn.com





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:2881
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-07-27 15:40:06
Subject:Free the PRican Political Prisoners!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign has moved our meeting location!!  If you 
want to join us at our next meeting it will take place at Charas, Inc. 
Uptown/El Barrio 170 E116th St. Suite 1W (between Lexington and Third 
Avenues).  We ask all people who are interested in participating in our 
Mumia activity or in the Bronx Puerto Rican Day Parade to join us at this 
special Meeting!!

Wednesday July 31st, 2002 at 6:30pm
Charas, Inc. Uptown/El Barrio
170 E116th St. Suite 1w (Lexington and 3rd Avenues)

FREE THE PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS!!
_______________________________________________________________________

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is launching a new campaign to raise money 
for Pedro Colon Almenas' mother, Gloria Almenas. When Pedro was
incarcerated his mother lost her only financial support.

Gloria is an elderly and ill woman. She needs our support!! Please send
her a check or money order to:

Gloria Almenas
PO Box 30724
San Juan, PR 00929-1724
________________________________________________________________________

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is making a public call to all
organizations to endorse our Freedom Challenge!! ProLibertad has committed 
itself to raise $10,000 for Mumia Abu Jamal's Legal Defense!!

Join our challenge, by raising money and attending our FREEDOM CELEBRATION 
ON SATURDAY AUGUST 24TH, 2002!!

If you are interested in ENDORSING the Freedom Celebration and the Challenge 
to raise $10,000, then please call 212-927-9065 or email
ProLibertad@... to add your organization to our list!!

Please pass the word along!!
_______________________________________________________________________

Take the ProLibertad Freedom Campaign to Free Puerto Rican Political
Prisoners Challenge!!

We have committed to Raise $10,000 for Mumia's Legal Defense Fund.
How much can you raise? FREEDOM is possible we can do this!!

Bring your $5, $50, $500, Checks payable to the
National Black United Fund/For Mumia's Legal Defense Fund

Join the Freedom Celebration!! MUMIA WILL BE FREE!* MUSIC * POETRY *FOOD!!

Invited Guests* Rosemari Mealy * Amina Baraka * Zayid Mohammed * Sandra
Rodriquez * * Safiya Bukhari * Yerba Buena
Open mike if time permits

Saturday, August 24, 4pm to 8pm
St. Mary's Church
521 West 126 St. Broadway and Amsterdam Avenue
Donation $10/Dinner $5.

For More Information:
ProLibertad 212-927-9065 ProLibertad.org
Free Mumia Abu Jamal Coalition 212-330-8029 Freemumia.com
______________________________________________________________________

Join the ProLibertad Freedom Campaign on Sunday August 4th, 2002 at 8am
for the Bronx Puerto Rican Day Parade!!

Every year ProLibertad organizes a contingent to this wonderful parade.
Each year we hand out literature on The Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, 
Puerto Rico and Vieques!!

This year we are going to try to collect a thousand signatures for our new 
Freedom Petition!! We need you to help us reach our goal!!

We need volunteers to help us leaflet, collect petitions and of COURSE TO 
MARCH IN THE FREEDOM CONTINGENT!!

If you are interested in joining the contingent please contact
ProLibertad@... or call our Bronx Office 718-601-4751

JOIN US ON SUNDAY AUGUST 4TH,2002 AT 8AM
AT W174TH ST AND GRAND CONCOURSE
TAKE THE D TRAIN TO 174TH-175TH
_______________________________________________________________________

Situation of Robert Rabin and Hiram Lozada in the Federal Prison,
Guaynabo, PR

On Thursday, July 18 around 6 PM, Prisoners for Peace in Vieques
Robert (Bob) Rabin and Attorney Hiram Lozada, President of the Human
Rights Committee of the Puerto Rico Lawyer's Guild, were transferred -
without any explanation or notice - from Unit 1A (minimum security)
to Unit 1B, which has more restrictions such as limiting visits to
one afternoon per week, only for immediate family members. Rabin has
been denied the right to make telephone calls - not even to his
mother, who resides in Boston. It should be noted that recently these
two men - who are completing sentences of six (Rabin) and four
(Lozada) months for the misdemeanor offence of entering the bombing
range in Vieques to halt the bombing last April - publicly denounced
a series of violations of the prisoners' rights.

We call on all whoare committed to peace and human rights to communicate 
with theprison, in order to express concern for the well-being of 
ourprisoners for peace in Vieques.

Telephone calls and faxed letters maybe sent to the official in charge of 
prisoners' issues: Attorney Alma L�pez, Tel:(787)749-4480; 
Fax:(787)775-7824.

Situation of Robert Rabin and Hiram Lozada in the Federal Prison,
Guaynabo, PR

On Thursday, July 18 around 6 PM, Prisoners for Peace in Vieques
Robert (Bob) Rabin and Attorney Hiram Lozada, President of the Human
Rights Committee of the Puerto Rico Lawyer's Guild, were transferred -
without any explanation or notice - from Unit 1A (minimum security)
to Unit 1B, which has more restrictions such as limiting visits to
one afternoon per week, only for immediate family members. Rabin has
been denied the right to make telephone calls - not even to his
mother, who resides in Boston. It should be noted that recently these
two men - who are completing sentences of six (Rabin) and four
(Lozada) months for the misdemeanor offence of entering the bombing
range in Vieques to halt the bombing last April - publicly denounced
a series of violations of the prisoners' rights.

We call on all whoare committed to peace and human rights to communicate
with theprison, in order to express concern for the well-being of our
prisoners for peace in Vieques.

Telephone calls and faxed letters maybe sent to the official in charge of 
prisoners' issues: Attorney Alma L�pez, Tel:(787)749-4480;
Fax:(787)775-7824.

How much can you raise? FREEDOM is possible we can do this!!

Bring your $5, $50, $500, Checks payable to the
National Black United Fund/For Mumia's Legal Defense Fund

Join the Freedom Celebration!! MUMIA WILL BE FREE!* MUSIC * POETRY *FOOD!!

Invited Guests* Rosemari Mealy * Amina Baraka * Zayid Mohammed * Sandra
Rodriquez * * Safiya Bukhari * Yerba Buena
Open mike if time permits

Saturday, August 24, 4pm to 8pm
St. Mary's Church
521 West 126 St. Broadway and Amsterdam Avenue
Donation $10/Dinner $5.

For More Information:
ProLibertad 212-927-9065 ProLibertad.org
Free Mumia Abu Jamal Coalition 212-330-8029 Freemumia.com
______________________________________________________________________

Situation of Robert Rabin and Hiram Lozada in the Federal Prison,
Guaynabo, PR

On Thursday, July 18 around 6 PM, Prisoners for Peace in Vieques
Robert (Bob) Rabin and Attorney Hiram Lozada, President of the Human
Rights Committee of the Puerto Rico Lawyer's Guild, were transferred -
without any explanation or notice - from Unit 1A (minimum security)
to Unit 1B, which has more restrictions such as limiting visits to
one afternoon per week, only for immediate family members. Rabin has
been denied the right to make telephone calls - not even to his
mother, who resides in Boston. It should be noted that recently these
two men - who are completing sentences of six (Rabin) and four
(Lozada) months for the misdemeanor offence of entering the bombing
range in Vieques to halt the bombing last April - publicly denounced
a series of violations of the prisoners' rights.

We call on all whoare committed to peace and human rights to communicate
with theprison, in order to express concern for the well-being of our
prisoners for peace in Vieques.

Telephone calls and faxed letters maybe sent to the official in charge of 
prisoners' issues: Attorney Alma L�pez, Tel:(787)749-4480;
Fax:(787)775-7824.



_________________________________________________________________
Send and receive Hotmail on your mobile device: http://mobile.msn.com





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:2889
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-08-05 12:50:04
Subject:ProLibertad Digest Week of 8/5/02
Message:

Intifada!

Join the NY Solidarity Movement for a Free Palestine, a majority people
of color group, for a special report back from the recent
delegation to Palestine.

Members will speak about the solidarity actions they took part in in
Rammallah and Nablus.  They will speak about their travels to Jerico
visiting the Afrikan Palestinian Community and will discuss the 
similaritiesin struggles for self-determination of people in the US and 
Palestine.


Come be inspired by stories of the fearless Palestinian struggle for
freedom also featuring live performances and a film screening (TBA)

Where: Prison Moratorium Project
              388 Atlantic Ave
             Brooklyn, NY 11217
             Take A,C,G to Hoyt Schemerhorn
When: Friday Aug, 9th
            Starting at 7:30 PM
Donation: $5 at the door, Refreshments will be available


For More information Contact Blu at 718-260-8805 or e-mail: 
education@...
________________________________________________________________________

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is launching a new campaign to raise money 
for Pedro Colon Almenas' mother, Gloria Almenas. When Pedro was
incarcerated his mother lost her only financial support.

Gloria is an elderly and ill woman. She needs our support!! Please send
her a check or money order to:

Gloria Almenas
PO Box 30724
San Juan, PR 00929-1724
________________________________________________________________________

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is making a public call to all
organizations to endorse our Freedom Challenge!! ProLibertad has
committeditself to raise $10,000 for Mumia Abu Jamal's Legal Defense!!

Join our challenge, by raising money and attending our FREEDOM CELEBRATIONON
SATURDAY AUGUST 24TH, 2002!!

If you are interested in ENDORSING the Freedom Celebration and the Challenge 
to raise $10,000, then please call 212-927-9065 or email
ProLibertad@... to add your organization to our list!!

Please pass the word along!!

Situation of Robert Rabin and Hiram Lozada in the Federal Prison,
Guaynabo, PR

On Thursday, July 18 around 6 PM, Prisoners for Peace in Vieques
Robert (Bob) Rabin and Attorney Hiram Lozada, President of the Human

without any explanation or notice - from Unit 1A (minimum security)
to Unit 1B, which has more restrictions such as limiting visits to
one afternoon per week, only for immediate family members. Rabin has
been denied the right to make telephone calls - not even to his
mother, who resides in Boston. It should be noted that recently these
two men - who are completing sentences of six (Rabin) and four
(Lozada) months for the misdemeanor offence of entering the bombing
range in Vieques to halt the bombing last April - publicly denounced
a series of violations of the prisoners' rights.

Subject:SUPPORT BLACK AUGUST
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging folks who believe in liberation, 
freedom and revolution to support this awesome activity.  Black August's 
roots are based in demanding freedom and revolution.

Tickets go on sale on Monday August 12th.  Start saving money and buy 
tickets, motivate others to buys tickets and support the amazing work that 
the Malcolm X Grassroots Movement is doing for the freedom of all Political 
Prisoners!!

_______________________________________________________________________

The 5th ANNUAL BLACK AUGUST BENEFIT CONCERT 2002

REPARATIONS MOVEMENT

@SYNOD HALL 110th ST. & AMSTERDAM AVE.

w/Akebulon * Tye Phoneix * Rise and Shine * Hip Hop Project * DJ Life * 
Hosted by MTV�s Sway and La Bruja from Def Poetry Jam

MALCOLM X GRASSROOTS MOVEMENT * 718-622-8292 * mxgmny@...

Post ID:2893
Sender:"cliff smith" <cliffsmith69@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-08-06 19:48:28
Subject:nb activists' trial friday, 9am
Message:

the trial of new brunswick peoples' campaign city council candidate joseph 
smith and cliff smith against high school principal pierre embrey and board 
of education special security officer donald bowling is scheduled for this 
friday, 9:00 am, in the muncipal courthouse on kirkpatrick st.  it is open 
to the public.

assault charges were filed against each other following a confrontation that 
occured when cliff smith was forcibly removed from the meeting after 
distributing copies of the city school's test scores, which are the lowest 
in middlesex county.

51% of 11th graders passed the hspt, required for graduation.  12% of 
lincoln 4th graders passed their test.

new brunswick's board of education is appointed by mayor cahill.  it is the 
only un-elected school board in the county.  joseph smith, who co-ordinated 
the elected school board referendum in 2000, is running with police officer 
james neal for mayor and danny rosado for city council on the peoples' 
campaign slate.

for info, contact cliff smith 732.214.8828



unite the many, defeat the few!


_________________________________________________________________
Chat with friends online, try MSN Messenger: http://messenger.msn.com

Post ID:2894
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-08-07 22:40:17
Subject:ProLibertad for Reparations!!
Message:

Join the ProLibertad Freedom Campaign on August 17th, 2002 in Washington DC 
to support Reparations for the African American communities in the United 
States!!

On Saturday August 17th, 2002 millions will rally to Washington DC to
support the African-American Reparations movement.

It is time that the ancestors of  the slaves that built this country be 
given the economic reparations they deserve to build schools and hospitals.

For decades, the solidarity between Latin@s and African-Americans has 
strengthened both our movements for social justice and freedom.

We must stand together again in Washington DC on Saturday
August 17th, 2002!!

Join the ProLibertad for Reparations Contingent!!  Contact ProLibertad for a 
bus ticket today (only $20-30 round trip), we've got tickets on the Mumia 
Coalition Buses!!

Call us at 718-601-4751, 212-927-9065, or email ProLibertad@...



_________________________________________________________________
Chat with friends online, try MSN Messenger: http://messenger.msn.com

Post ID:2896
Sender:"cliff smith" <cliffsmith69@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-08-08 20:04:13
Subject:unity proposal, nb election
Message:

New Brunswick Peoples� Campaign 2002
unite the many, defeat the few!

Strike Together--First Beat Cahill/J&J�s shill!

The local split between progressive forces will guarantee one thing: victory 
to the backwards rule of J-Cahill, his cohorts, and especially the 
imperialist dictators he represents.   But a truce can, if we do the work, 
bring us to the doorstep of peoples� victory.

The Peoples� Campaign offers to immediately withdraw the candidacy of Joe 
Smith for city council, if it will help advance a united peoples� campaign.  
  This leaves us with 5 candidates for 3 positions, the deadline for ballot 
adjustments being September 12.  If we truly represent the people, we need 
to make moves now.

Informal discussions between members of the campaigns resulted in the 
proposal of a late-August joint, public event centered around mutual 
endorsement of each other�s ballot issues: functioning rent control and an 
elected board of education.  The intent being to bring the two groups to the 
same table in working unity, to strengthen the issues, and to create motion 
toward one democratic campaign, not two.

*Cahill can be expected to draw 5000+ votes in a tight race.
*Factoring the cheat, we must pull 10,000 votes to ensure a win.
*Ras Baraka lost Newark City Council by 114 votes of 9,000.
*Bush2 won(?) tie-breaking Florida by several hundred.
*We cannot afford a close race--it must be all-out!

Lenin said �March separately, strike together!�  Let us also.

Cliff Smith
732.214.8828







unite the many, defeat the few!





unite the many, defeat the few!

************************************************************************
Non-Hierarchal Social Structures Project - A Mutual Aid Network of Ideas and 
Information:
http://www.dualpower.net
AIM: McJihad

- "In a free nation where Slaves are not allow'd of, the surest Wealth 
consists in a Multitude of laborious Poor . . . As they ought to be kept 
from starving, so they should receive nothing worth saving . . . It is in 
the Interests of all rich Nations , that the greater part of the Poor should 
almost never be idle, and yet continually spent what they get . . . The Poor 
should be strictly kept to Work, and it was Prudence to relieve their wants, 
but Folly to cure them" - Bernard de Mandeville (1670 - 1733)
************************************************************************

> 
> - "In a free nation where Slaves are not allow'd of, the surest 
Wealth
> consists in a Multitude of laborious Poor . . . As they ought to 
be kept
> from starving, so they should receive nothing worth saving . . . 
It is in
> the Interests of all rich Nations , that the greater part of the 
Poor should
> almost never be idle, and yet continually spent what they 
get . . . The Poor
> should be strictly kept to Work, and it was Prudence to relieve 
their wants,
> but Folly to cure them" - Bernard de Mandeville (1670 - 1733)
> 
*********************************************************************
***
>

> Join the world's largest e-mail service with MSN Hotmail.
> http://www.hotmail.com

> To Unsubscribe, send a blank message to: 
> nbpeoplescampaign-unsubscribe@e...

> unite the many, defeat the few!

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:2900
Sender:"Stevphen Shukaitis" <patrioticdissent@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-08-10 00:51:19
Subject:Re: [nbpc] ProLibertad for Reparations!!
Message:

Well, no. I don't think such has anything to do with "watering it down" but 
with a disagrement about the root problem that has to be dealt with.
For example - one can discuss the past 400 years in relation of how they 
have been filled with slavery, violence, and many forms of racist oppresion 
- but it is of utmost importance to discuss why such occurred.
The slave trade, the imperialist domination and confiscation of resource, 
the continuing forms of discrimination, etc . . . are almost entirely 
rationalizations for the power relations of economic conquest and control: 
ie. capitalism. and this way the relation of the plunder of native american 
lands, of the oppression of women, etc . . . are not watering down the cause 
but are all intrinsically linked.

so - to demand reparations, which is completely justified - in a way that 
just reinforces the capitalist and imperialist model which was by and large 
the very cause of much of the suffering, is somewhat counterproductive. 
perhaps I'm just being reductionistic - but, what would the logic be for the 
necessity of repartions for african americans that did not acknowledge the 
brazen exploitation of other groups, even if such was on a much smaller 
scale?

Stevphen


>From: "brown_suga_bbw" <brown_suga_bbw@...>
>Reply-To: nbpeoplescampaign@yahoogroups.com

************************************************************************
Non-Hierarchal Social Structures Project - A Mutual Aid Network of Ideas and 
Information:
http://www.dualpower.net
AIM: McJihad

- "In a free nation where Slaves are not allow'd of, the surest Wealth 
consists in a Multitude of laborious Poor . . . As they ought to be kept 
from starving, so they should receive nothing worth saving . . . It is in 
the Interests of all rich Nations , that the greater part of the Poor should 
almost never be idle, and yet continually spent what they get . . . The Poor 
should be strictly kept to Work, and it was Prudence to relieve their wants, 
but Folly to cure them" - Bernard de Mandeville (1670 - 1733)
************************************************************************

MSN Photos is the easiest way to share and print your photos: 
http://photos.msn.com/support/worldwide.aspx

Post ID:2901
Sender:"cliff smith" <cliffsmith69@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-08-10 13:09:04
Subject:Re: [nbpc] ProLibertad for Reparations!!
Message:

we 100% for Afro-American reparations.  maybe see you at the rally in 
Elizabeth today...

you define 'reparations' to me.  my understanding is 'compensation for a 
wrong done'.  we tryin to see all wrongs compensated. not in any way to 
water down the right of the Black Nation to reparations & 
self-determination.  shd we deny compensation to the native Akwesasne 
(American 'Indian') peoples?

holla back.

Message:

Once again I say we are not against anyone else getting their 
reparations but the millions for reparations march in washington on 
which I am a local oranizer of is for african american reparaions, 
you  can argue  the horrors of a capitlist system until you are blue 
in the face but  what we are fighting for is a movement for us by us, 
for far tooo long the  our people hve been exploited by other groups 
seeking to atacch themselves to  our struggle, and what we are saying 
is enough is enough its time that we stand for ourselves.--- In

Post ID:2903
Sender:"cliff smith" <cliffsmith69@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-08-10 13:48:09
Subject:Re: [nbpc] ProLibertad for Reparations!!
Message:

b_s_b:

we fully w/ yr march, yr demands, a 'movement for/by you', the attack on 
'other groups seeking to atacch themselves to  our struggle', & the 
anticipation of that based on the long history of white opportunism.

if there's anything we can do to promote the march or the cause, please let 
us know.

but for our part, it seems that in the overall, the acknowledgement of all 
oppressions (on the basis of self-determination & equality), strengthens all 
the 'for/by us' movements. no?

but either way, we support yr march & are glad for yr work.

cliff

 >  > AIM: McJihad
 >  >
 >  > - "In a free nation where Slaves are not allow'd of, the surest
 > Wealth
 >  > consists in a Multitude of laborious Poor . . . As they ought to
 > be kept
 >  > from starving, so they should receive nothing worth saving . . .
 > It is in
 >  > the Interests of all rich Nations , that the greater part of the
 > Poor should
 >  > almost never be idle, and yet continually spent what they
 > get . . . The Poor
 >  > should be strictly kept to Work, and it was Prudence to relieve
 > their wants,
 >  > but Folly to cure them" - Bernard de Mandeville (1670 - 1733)
 >  >
 >
*********************************************************************
 > ***
 >  >
 >  > _________________________________________________________________
 >  > Join the world's largest e-mail service with MSN Hotmail.
 >  > http://www.hotmail.com
 >  >
 >  >
 >  >
 >  > To Post a message, send it to:   nbpeoplescampaign@e...
 >  >
 >  > To Unsubscribe, send a blank message to:
 >  > nbpeoplescampaign-unsubscribe@e...
 >  >
 >  > Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to
 > http://docs.yahoo.com/info/terms/
 >  >
 >  >
 >  >
 >  >
 >  >
 >  >
 >  >
 >  >
 >  >
 >  > unite the many, defeat the few!
 >  >
 >  >
 >  > _________________________________________________________________
 >  > Chat with friends online, try MSN Messenger:
 > http://messenger.msn.com
 >

 >
 > unite the many, defeat the few!

http://mobile.msn.com

Post ID:2904
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-08-10 15:22:14
Subject:ProLibertad Mumia/Reparations/Vieques!!
Message:

Join the ProLibertad Freedom Campaign on August 17th, 2002 in Washington DC 
to support Reparations for the African American communities in the United 
States!!

On Saturday August 17th, 2002 millions will rally to Washington DC to
support the African-American Reparations movement.

It is time that the ancestors of  the slaves that built this country be
given the economic reparations they deserve to build schools and hospitals.

For decades, the solidarity between Latin@s and African-Americans has
strengthened both our movements for social justice and freedom.

We must stand together again in Washington DC on Saturday
August 17th, 2002!!

Join the ProLibertad for Reparations Contingent!!  Contact ProLibertad for a 
bus ticket today (only $20-30 round trip), we've got tickets on the Mumia 
Coalition Buses!!

Call us at 718-601-4751, 212-927-9065, or email ProLibertad@...
________________________________________________________________________

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is making a public call to all
organizations to endorse our Freedom Challenge!! ProLibertad has
committeditself to raise $10,000 for Mumia Abu Jamal's Legal Defense!!

Join our challenge, by raising money and attending our FREEDOM CELEBRATION 
ON SATURDAY AUGUST 24TH, 2002!!

If you are interested in ENDORSING the Freedom Celebration and the Challenge 
to raise $10,000, then please call 212-927-9065 or email 
ProLibertad@... to add your organization to our list!! Please pass 
the word along!!
_______________________________________________________________________ Take 
the ProLibertad Freedom Campaign to Free Puerto Rican Political
Prisoners Challenge!! We have committed to Raise $10,000 for Mumia's Legal 
Defense Fund.

How much can you raise? FREEDOM is possible we can do this!! Bring your $5, 
$50, $500, Checks payable to the National Black United Fund/For Mumia's 
Legal Defense Fund Join the Freedom Celebration!!

MUMIA WILL BE FREE!* MUSIC * POETRY *FOOD!! Invited Guests* Rosemari Mealy * 
Amina Baraka * Zayid Mohammed * Sandra
Rodriquez * * Safiya Bukhari * Yerba Buena

Open mike if time permits Saturday, August 24, 4pm to 8pm
St. Mary's Church 521 West 126 St. Broadway and Amsterdam Avenue

Donation $10/Dinner $5. For More Information:
ProLibertad 212-927-9065 ProLibertad.org
Free Mumia Abu Jamal Coalition 212-330-8029 Freemumia.com
______________________________________________________________________ 
Situation of Robert Rabin and Hiram Lozada in the Federal Prison,
Guaynabo, PR

On Thursday, July 18 around 6 PM, Prisoners for Peace in Vieques Robert 
(Bob) Rabin and Attorney Hiram Lozada, President of the Human Rights 
Committee of the Puerto Rico Lawyer's Guild, were transferred - without any 
explanation or notice - from Unit 1A (minimum security) to Unit 1B, which 
has more restrictions such as limiting visits to one afternoon per week, 
only for immediate family members. Rabin has been denied the right to make 
telephone calls - not even to his mother, who resides in Boston. It should 
be noted that recently these two men - who are completing sentences of six 
(Rabin) and four (Lozada) months for the misdemeanor offence of entering the 
bombing range in Vieques to halt the bombing last April - publicly denounced 
a series of violations of the prisoners' rights.

We call on all who are committed to peace and human rights to communicate 
with theprison, in order to express concern for the well-being of our 
prisoners for peace in Vieques.

Telephone calls and faxed letters maybe sent to the official in charge of 
prisoners' issues: Attorney Alma L�pez, Tel:(787)749-4480; 
Fax:(787)775-7824.




_________________________________________________________________
Chat with friends online, try MSN Messenger: http://messenger.msn.com

Situation of Robert Rabin and Hiram Lozada in the Federal Prison,
Guaynabo, PR

On Thursday, July 18 around 6 PM, Prisoners for Peace in Vieques Robert 
(Bob) Rabin and Attorney Hiram Lozada, President of the Human Rights 
Committee of the Puerto Rico Lawyer's Guild, were transferred - without any 
explanation or notice - from Unit 1A (minimum security) to Unit 1B, which 
has more restrictions such as limiting visits to one afternoon per week, 
only for immediate family members. Rabin has been denied the right to make 
telephone calls - not even to his mother, who resides in Boston. It should 
be noted that recently these two men - who are completing sentences of six 
(Rabin) and four (Lozada) months for the misdemeanor offence of entering the 
bombing range in Vieques to halt the bombing last April - publicly denounced 
a series of violations of the prisoners' rights.

We call on all who are committed to peace and human rights to communicate 
with theprison, in order to express concern for the well-being of our 
prisoners for peace in Vieques.

Telephone calls and faxed letters maybe sent to the official in charge of 
prisoners' issues: Attorney Alma L�pez, Tel:(787)749-4480; 
Fax:(787)775-7824.

Post ID:2906
Sender:"Stevphen Shukaitis" <patrioticdissent@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-08-12 22:42:43
Subject:History of New Brunswick
Message:

Greetings -

My name is Stevphen Shukaitis; I'm beginning work on a people's history of 
New Brunswick. Having read the recent Home-News Tribune supplement 
(�Building a New New Brunswick,� 7/30/02), with its blatantly pro-corporate 
bias and complete lack of discussion or analysis of how development has 
affected the communities and people of New Brunswick, we thought such a 
project would be a good way to get out other sides of the story and share 
information not often circulated in the current media coverage of the 
situation.

If you have information about any of the following topics (or know people 
that do) it would be greatly appreciated if you could forward the
information to me:
-anything to do with changes in communities and the area
-DevCo, CORE, and other redevelopment/gentrification efforts
-police corruption, brutality, and police-community relations
- machine politics, the internal working of city government and
relation to community
-students, Rutgers, and their relation and effects of students and 
overenrollment on New Brunswick
-all existing community organizations and resources geared to building
communities
-issues concerning New Brunswick schools and their performance
-information on employment, jobs, and related issues
-information on health care and its availability
-anything else that you think is important and should be included in
formulating a more complete history of the city

Sincerely,
Stevphen Shukaitis
97 Jones Avenue
New Brunswick, NJ 08901
732-846-1056

PS - There are also tentative plans being made for a Tenant's Rights
picnic on October 5th. If you would like to become involved with that
please contact me.

_________________________________________________________________
Join the world�s largest e-mail service with MSN Hotmail. 
http://www.hotmail.com

Post ID:2910
Sender:"cliff smith" <cliffsmith69@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-08-15 14:53:34
Subject:Fwd: [coalitionforjustice] PRESS RELEASE: POP-NJ at August 17th Reparations Rally in DC (Transportation Available)
Message:



----Original Message Follows----
From: William Courson <williamcourson@...>
Reply-To: coalitionforjustice@yahoogroups.com
To: wacourson@...
Subject: [coalitionforjustice] PRESS RELEASE: POP-NJ at August 17th 
Reparations Rally in DC (Transportation Available)
Date: Thu, 15 Aug 2002 05:17:49 -0700 (PDT)

PEOPLE'S ORGANIZATION FOR PROGRESS
POST OFFICE BOX 22505
NEWARK, NEW JERSEY 07101-2505
(973) 801-0001

FOR IMMEDIATE PRESS RELEASE

FOR FURTHER INFORMATION CONTACT:
LAWRENCE HAMM (973) 801-0001

PRESS CONFERENCE:

PLAINTIFF IN REPARATIONS LAWSUIT JOINS
PEOPLE'S ORGANIZATION FOR PROGRESS IN CALL
FOR AUGUST 17 REPARATIONS RALLY IN WASHINGTON, D.C.

The People's Organization For Progress (POP) will hold
a press conference on Thursday, August 15, 2002, 12:00
noon at the WISOMMM headquarters, 53 Lincoln Park in
Newark, New Jersey to publicly announce support for
the rally for reparations for African Americans in
Washington, D.C. on Saturday and its plans to mobilize
New Jersey residents to attend.  POP leaders and other
community activists will be joined by Richard E.
Barber, Sr. a plaintiff in a reparations lawsuit.

Mr. Barber is a plaintiff in a class-action lawsuit
against New York Life Insurance, Brown Brothers
Harriman & Co. and Norfolk Southern for allegedly
profiting either directly or indirectly from the
unpaid labor of enslaved African Americans.

-END-

Post ID:2915
Sender:"Stevphen Shukaitis" <stevphen@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-08-21 00:26:30
Subject:Tomorrow!
Message:

Sorry about that. The message got erased before I could get your number.
I'll call you tomorrow. Perhaps we could talk at the following event.

Stevphen
[Please forward widely and quickly]

On Wednesday at 5PM the city clerk will present to city council the
petition circulated by the Community Empowerment Project and New Brunswick
United to put stricter rent control on the ballot in November. The CEP is
encouraging all parties interested in seeing this effort to create more
just rental conditions in New Brunswick to attend the meeting and voice
their support for such measures in any manner they see fit. Although the
petition has over 1,000 signatures, it is all but assured that the
legitimacy and validity of evert last one will be challenged in efforts to
stop the measure from reaching the ballot.

The proposed act to be put on the ballot in November will freeze rents as
of May 2002 for one year, abolish vacancy decontrol, and cap all rent
increases at the rate of inflation (with exceptions for improvements to
the house and other such exceptions). It will greatly help to alleviate
many of the problems faced by New Brunswick residents in regards to ever
higher rents brought on by �business revitalization� and other such
measures.

Establishing a strong and unified presence at the meeting is necessary to
the importance and urgency of such measures. If the council rejects or
attempts the validity of the petition, court motions will be filed in
reponse by Thursday morning. For more information call 732-246-1130.





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:2916
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-08-21 11:50:33
Subject:Mumia August 24th
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is making a public call to all
organizations to endorse our Freedom Challenge!! ProLibertad has
committeditself to raise $10,000 for Mumia Abu Jamal's Legal Defense!!

Join our challenge, by raising money and attending our FREEDOM CELEBRATION 
ON SATURDAY AUGUST 24TH, 2002!!

If you are interested in ENDORSING the Freedom Celebration and the Challenge 
to raise $10,000, then please call 212-927-9065 or email
ProLibertad@... to add your organization to our list!! Please pass 
the word along!!
_______________________________________________________________________ Take 
the ProLibertad Freedom Campaign to Free Puerto Rican Political
Prisoners Challenge!! We have committed to Raise $10,000 for Mumia's Legal 
Defense Fund.

How much can you raise? FREEDOM is possible we can do this!! Bring your $5, 
$50, $500, Checks payable to the National Black United Fund/For Mumia's 
Legal Defense Fund Join the Freedom Celebration!!

MUMIA WILL BE FREE!* MUSIC * POETRY *FOOD!! Invited Guests* Rosemari Mealy * 
Amina Baraka * Zayid Mohammed * Sandra
Rodriquez * * Safiya Bukhari * Yerba Buena

Open mike if time permits Saturday, August 24, 4pm to 8pm
St. Mary's Church 521 West 126 St. Broadway and Amsterdam Avenue

Donation $10/Dinner $5. For More Information:
ProLibertad 212-927-9065 ProLibertad.org
Free Mumia Abu Jamal Coalition 212-330-8029 Freemumia.com

Endorsers:
Popular Defense for Palestine Committee
Alvaro Luna Hernandez National Freedom Coalition
Houstonians United for Mumia
Anarchist Black Cross Network
CRITICAL RESISTANCE/New York City
Malcolm X Grassroots Movement
La Iglesia san Romero De Las Americas
Free the Five New York
La Iglesia San Juan Bautista
Asians for Mumia
Mumia Working Group
GeetaGirl

Post ID:2918
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-08-22 18:31:12
Subject:NEW VIEQUES POLITICAL PRISOENRS!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign has just received a communication from 
Puerto Rico informing us that the following three brothers have been 
arrested and are being kept without bail.

All three are young Vieques Activists (Pedro and Cacimar are the sons of 
Taso Zenon who was recently released from MDC Guaynabo)who have been active 
in civil disobedience and organizing in Vieques.

Please write to them and send them your support!!
Their addresses are

Cacimar: 19532-069
Pedro: 19532-069
Rega (Regalado) 19775-069
MDC Guayanabo
PO Box 2147
San Juan PR 00922-2147

*****THIS EMAIL WILL BE FOLLWOED WITH AN ACTION EMAIL*****

Post ID:2920
Sender:"Charlotte L. Kates" <ckates@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-08-23 17:38:05
Subject:Community Guide to Rutgers and New Brunswick, 2002-2003!! (fwd)
Message:

Hi, everyone!

The much-discussed community guide/agenda project/etc is about to become a
reality--and it needs you! Your art, your photographs, your writing, and
your submissions and suggestions for:
-groups/organizations/institutions to list
-quotes/excerpts from other authors to include
-topics/sections
-whatever else you want to see!

The Community Guide/Agenda is designed to provide entering students at
Douglass College and Rutgers University with a ready-reference handbook to
the progressive and socially-active organizations in our campus and
community, as well as much needed information to become an active member
of the community, providing information such as meeting times for student
government associations and New Brunswick City Council, voter registration
information, deadlines and addresses, civil-rights information of which
students should be made aware and similar necessary information.

Following in the tradition of the Concordia Student Union
(http://www.csu.tao.ca/) at Concordia University in Montreal, Quebec,
Canada, the community guide will be not merely a planner and a list of
names, addresses, and email contact info, but also a space for art,
writing, and other uncensored progressive student expression. Themes for
sections of the Guide include:

-Corporate vs. People's Redevelopment in New Brunswick
-Student Autonomy and Power
-Women's Issues
-Fighting Racism and Oppression
-International Solidarity
-Exposing the "War on Terror" and Defending Civil Liberties
-Queer Issues, Identity and Sexuality
-Working-class Struggle and Victory
-Corporations, National and Multinational
-Independent Media
-Campus/Community Involvement and Alliance

The many ways in which these themes can be expanded is nearly
endless--from rent control, to opposing military tests on Vieques, to the
power of student-controlled student fees, to...whatever! 

Therefore, I need your art and photography, to make this guide visually
exciting and interesting! If you are not a visual artist yourself, feel
free to submit and suggest the work of progressive artists who don't mind
us using their work (we'll attribute, of course). I also need your
(somewhat short) writing. Even I need to be somewhat tightly restrained  
in word count, since we're going for short, quick bus reads here. So don't
worry about producing full, long articles--short, pithy pieces are nothing
less than perfect. In the same vein, we also want quotes, excerpts, etc,
from others who have something important to say about these issues. 

The end result is to be a tapestry of struggle in words and images, and an
invitation to new students to join fully in their student and city
communities, ready for action! 

Of course...there is a deadline. 

Please send ANY suggestions ASAP to me here at ckates@...; if
you want to be on an email list to discuss, edit, etc, also email me and I
will add you! If you want to write something, let me know; if you want to
send art, let me know--if you have a submission by another artist/writer
and can't locate it, it's fine--I can also try to locate the reference
:-) Let me know *that* you want to write/contribute so I can allocate
space in layout...and send me your materials by NEXT Friday, August 30 at
midnight! 

This does have to go to the publisher, so timeliness is essential--and I
can do your layout for you (although tell me what you want visually if you
have an aesthetic preference)! 

Let's make this happen!

In struggle and solidarity, 

Charlotte





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:2921
Sender:"Stevphen Shukaitis" <stevphen@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-08-24 12:22:07
Subject:Take Back the City Meeting / Planning Session
Message:

[please forward widely, though not obnoxiously]

On August 27th there will be a meeting / planning session for the creation
of the �Take Back the City, Take Back Our Communities� pamphlet. This
pamphlet is intended to create an awareness of the past 30 years of New
Brunswick history, how corporate redevelopment and �business
revitalization� have negatively affected communities, families, and
individuals.

The meeting will occur at 7 pm at 97 Jones Avenue near Douglass Campus. It
is a white house on the corner of Jones and Handy, one block off of
Commercial Avenue, several blocks off of Route 18. For further information
either call 732-846-1056 or send a message to
takebackthecity@....

Here is a rough sketch of the project:

Take Back the City, Take Back Our Communities
-a brief history of corporate redevelopment efforts and a sketch of
community based alternatives to them-

Purpose:
* To frame the history of political events in New Brunswick over the past
20 to 30 years and how they have affected communities.
* To use such to establish a �cultural memory� for transitory student
populations, residents that have moved here recently, and those who have
been taken in by the corporate media bias about the actual nature of
�development� and �revitalization� in New Brunswick.
* To use such as a jumping point for suggesting community based
alternatives and measures that can be created to balance out the forces of
business and the city government to create spaces for communities to
ensure their own viability and quality of life.

General Outline
I.Introduction
II.History and Overview of Past 20-30 Years
1.Devco/CORE
2.Democratic machine politics and their effects
3.Gentrification, Redevelopment, Revitalization
4.Changes in demography
5.Police Brutality
6.Student-Community Relations (lack of and effects of): how to get
students involved with the communities in which they live rather than
being apart from them?
7.Healthcare / Insurance
8.Employment
9.Daycare


III.Community Organization and Resources: a general sketch
1.Tenant's Union / Organization
2.Community Watch
3.Community Councils (based on wards)
4.Youth oriented associations
5.Cultural and arts oriented associations

IV.Resource and Existing Organizations
1.Legal information and assistance
2.Listing of organizations





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:2922
Sender:Eric Lerner <elerner@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-08-24 14:19:32
Subject:URGENT APPEAL for DETAINEE MEDICAL CARE
Message:

URGENT APPEAL!!
INS Detainees are being refused medical care at Camden County Jail in New
Jersey

Please contact the INS Authorities and the Warden at Camden County Jail to
protest these conditions.  Demand that these INS detainees have immediate
access to doctors and receive all appropriate treatment.  At the moment the
detainees are refused access to doctors and are only being given Tylenol to
treat serious medical problems.

***Wilfredo Pineda, an El Salvadoran INS Detainee - prisoner #91436, has a
throat infection and bad cough for more than a month.

****Charles Mora, a Cuban INS Detainee - prisoner #92347, is suffering from a
hernia.

****Farouk Abdel-Muhti, a Palestinian INS Detainee - prisoner #99870, is
suffering from heart pain.

David S. Owens, Jr., Warden
Camden County Jail
330 Federal Street, Camden NJ 08101
(PH) (856) 225-7632
(FAX) (856) 964-3207
dowens@...

Andrea J. Quarantillo
INS NJ District Director
INS Newark District Office
970 Broad St. Rm. 136
(PH) (973) 645-4421
(FAX) (973) 645-2304

Mass deportations are continuing with Middle Easterners and South Asians being
sent back to certain imprisonment, torture or death.   We do not know when the
INS takes detainees away whether they are going to another facility or being
deported.  On Thursday, August 22 Egyptian detainee Mohammed Abdel-Azim
Abdel-Hafez was taken out of Camden County Jail.  We are concerned he is being
deported to Egypt.  If you have information about this detainee please contact
us immediately.

Detentions and deportations must stop immediately!  Get involved by holding
teach-ins and mobilizing protests in support of the detainees.  For more
information on the detainees and how to get involved contact Workers Democracy
at http://www.workersdemocracy.org

Sign our petition to Defend the Bill of Rights! Defend the Detainees at
http://www.PetitionOnline.com/FreeDets/

This Urgent Appeal is being sent out by New Jersey Workers Democracy Network
To get more information on our activities contact Eric Lerner at
elerner@... or 609-406-7857

----Original Message Follows----
From: "Charlotte L. Kates" <ckates@...>
Reply-To: nbpeoplescampaign@yahoogroups.com
To: nbpeoplescampaign@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [nbpc] Community Guide to Rutgers and New Brunswick, 2002-2003!! 
(fwd)
Date: Fri, 23 Aug 2002 17:38:05 -0400 (EDT)


Hi, everyone!

The much-discussed community guide/agenda project/etc is about to become a
reality--and it needs you! Your art, your photographs, your writing, and
your submissions and suggestions for:
-groups/organizations/institutions to list
-quotes/excerpts from other authors to include
-topics/sections
-whatever else you want to see!

The Community Guide/Agenda is designed to provide entering students at
Douglass College and Rutgers University with a ready-reference handbook to
the progressive and socially-active organizations in our campus and
community, as well as much needed information to become an active member
of the community, providing information such as meeting times for student
government associations and New Brunswick City Council, voter registration
information, deadlines and addresses, civil-rights information of which
students should be made aware and similar necessary information.

Following in the tradition of the Concordia Student Union
(http://www.csu.tao.ca/) at Concordia University in Montreal, Quebec,
Canada, the community guide will be not merely a planner and a list of
names, addresses, and email contact info, but also a space for art,
writing, and other uncensored progressive student expression. Themes for
sections of the Guide include:

-Corporate vs. People's Redevelopment in New Brunswick
-Student Autonomy and Power
-Women's Issues
-Fighting Racism and Oppression
-International Solidarity
-Exposing the "War on Terror" and Defending Civil Liberties
-Queer Issues, Identity and Sexuality
-Working-class Struggle and Victory
-Corporations, National and Multinational
-Independent Media
-Campus/Community Involvement and Alliance

The many ways in which these themes can be expanded is nearly

power of student-controlled student fees, to...whatever!

Therefore, I need your art and photography, to make this guide visually
exciting and interesting! If you are not a visual artist yourself, feel
free to submit and suggest the work of progressive artists who don't mind
us using their work (we'll attribute, of course). I also need your
(somewhat short) writing. Even I need to be somewhat tightly restrained
in word count, since we're going for short, quick bus reads here. So don't
worry about producing full, long articles--short, pithy pieces are nothing
less than perfect. In the same vein, we also want quotes, excerpts, etc,
from others who have something important to say about these issues.

The end result is to be a tapestry of struggle in words and images, and an
invitation to new students to join fully in their student and city
communities, ready for action!

Of course...there is a deadline.

Please send ANY suggestions ASAP to me here at ckates@...; if
you want to be on an email list to discuss, edit, etc, also email me and I
will add you! If you want to write something, let me know; if you want to
send art, let me know--if you have a submission by another artist/writer
and can't locate it, it's fine--I can also try to locate the reference
:-) Let me know *that* you want to write/contribute so I can allocate
space in layout...and send me your materials by NEXT Friday, August 30 at
midnight!

This does have to go to the publisher, so timeliness is essential--and I
can do your layout for you (although tell me what you want visually if you
have an aesthetic preference)!

Let's make this happen!

In struggle and solidarity,

Charlotte

Post ID:2924
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-09-01 10:25:37
Subject:Mumia and Vieques!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is happy to report that the Freedom 
Challenge Activity to raise money for Mumia's Legal defense was a wonderful 
success!!

We raised nearly $5000 for Mumia's defense fund on that cold rainy Saturday 
afternoon.  Despite the weather, nealy 150-200 people were present and made 
freedom happen!!  We raised money, ate amazing Boricua Criolla, listened to 
impassioned speakers, and got down with amazing poetry and music!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Challenge is not over; we still need to raise $5000 
for Mumia's legal defense.  Now is the time to join the Challenge, we had 
many people sign up to help us raise money, BUT WE NEED MORE!!

If you are interested in joining the Challenge and raising money for Mumia 
by any means necessary email ProLibertad@...

FREE MUMIA!!
FREE THE PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS!!
_______________________________________________________________________

Vieques Support Campaign
http://palfrente.tripod.com
E-mail viequessc@...

  ____________________________________________________________

                 NO TO RACISM & IMPERIALIST WAR!
         U.S. NAVY OUT OF VIEQUES & ALL OF PUERTO RICO!
  ____________________________________________________________

                       - PLEASE FORWARD -

All out 4:30 p.m., on Tuesday, September 3rd in solidarity with the people 
of Vieques, Puerto Rico. The U.S. Navy will resume its bombing destruction 
of the island of Vieques on that day.

The U.S. Government plans to carry out its war against the world's oppressed 
peoples by using the pretense of war against terrorism, this time against 
the Iraqi people. Government officials are claiming that the Navy must 
remain in Vieques in order to rehearse for the invasion of Iraq. We can only 
conclude that the tragic events of September 11, 2001 are being used to 
promote U.S. domination of the world.

President George W. Bush had hypocritically promised to withdraw the U.S 
Navy from Vieques in 2003. Why is it hypocritical? Because he himself is 
promoting the bombing of Iraq.

No one knows better than Puertoricans what the aims of the U.S warmongers 
are. Puerto Rico is a completely controlled country under U.S. colonial 
rule. Just as the people of Vieques who have suffered health epidemics as a 
result of the U.S. Navy occupation on that island, all the people of Puerto 
Rico have been denied the right to decide matters concerning their economic, 
social and political life.

Puerto Ricans and all peace-loving people can make a difference - united we 
can stop the criminal actions of military and government officials. Vieques, 
Puerto Rico must not be used to bring about further death to the people of 
Iraq.

Place: Times Square (43rd and Broadway) New York City
Date: Tuesday, September 3rd
Time: 4:30 PM

Bring your flags, signs, musical instruments and above all your will and
spirit to fight injustice.


















_________________________________________________________________
Chat with friends online, try MSN Messenger: http://messenger.msn.com

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is happy to report that the Freedom 
Challenge Activity to raise money for Mumia's Legal defense was a wonderful 
success!!

We raised nearly $5000 for Mumia's defense fund on that cold rainy Saturday 
afternoon.  Despite the weather, nealy 150-200 people were present and made 
freedom happen!!  We raised money, ate amazing Boricua Criolla, listened to 
impassioned speakers, and got down with amazing poetry and music!!

The ProLibertad Freedom Challenge is not over; we still need to raise $5000 
for Mumia's legal defense.  Now is the time to join the Challenge, we had 
many people sign up to help us raise money, BUT WE NEED MORE!!

If you are interested in joining the Challenge and raising money for Mumia 
by any means necessary email ProLibertad@...

FREE MUMIA!!
FREE THE PUERTO RICAN POLITICAL PRISONERS!!
_______________________________________________________________________

Vieques Support Campaign
http://palfrente.tripod.com

  ____________________________________________________________

                 NO TO RACISM & IMPERIALIST WAR!
         U.S. NAVY OUT OF VIEQUES & ALL OF PUERTO RICO!
  ____________________________________________________________

                       - PLEASE FORWARD -

All out 4:30 p.m., on Tuesday, September 3rd in solidarity with the people 
of Vieques, Puerto Rico. The U.S. Navy will resume its bombing destruction 
of the island of Vieques on that day.

The U.S. Government plans to carry out its war against the world's oppressed 
peoples by using the pretense of war against terrorism, this time against 
the Iraqi people. Government officials are claiming that the Navy must 
remain in Vieques in order to rehearse for the invasion of Iraq. We can only 
conclude that the tragic events of September 11, 2001 are being used to 
promote U.S. domination of the world.

President George W. Bush had hypocritically promised to withdraw the U.S 
Navy from Vieques in 2003. Why is it hypocritical? Because he himself is 
promoting the bombing of Iraq.

No one knows better than Puertoricans what the aims of the U.S warmongers 
are. Puerto Rico is a completely controlled country under U.S. colonial 
rule. Just as the people of Vieques who have suffered health epidemics as a 
result of the U.S. Navy occupation on that island, all the people of Puerto 
Rico have been denied the right to decide matters concerning their economic, 
social and political life.

Puerto Ricans and all peace-loving people can make a difference - united we 
can stop the criminal actions of military and government officials. Vieques, 
Puerto Rico must not be used to bring about further death to the people of 
Iraq.

Place: Times Square (43rd and Broadway) New York City
Date: Tuesday, September 3rd
Time: 4:30 PM

Bring your flags, signs, musical instruments and above all your will and
spirit to fight injustice.




















_________________________________________________________________
Send and receive Hotmail on your mobile device: http://mobile.msn.com

members of the Puerto Rican Independence Party were arrested for engaging in 
civil disobedeince in the restricted Bombing ranges in Vieques:

H�ctor Gonz�lez Pereira
Ferm�n Candelario
�ngel Rafael Figueroa
Sigfredo V�lez Molina
Jaime L�pez

As of yet, no new information besides what was just written is known about 
their current status or location.  Please be on alert, another email with 
more information on these new Vieques Political Prisoners will be published 
shortly.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:2928
Sender:"Stevphen Shukaitis" <stevphen@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-09-04 11:28:28
Subject:Radical Rush in New Brunswick
Message:

[Please Forward Widely]

Every year numerous groups and associations have events to introduce
themselves to the incoming student body and the communities in which they
live. Curiously, those who hold radical political ideals about social
change almost never do anything to present themselves to the students or
the community. Therefore this year there will be held a "Radical Rush," a
weeklong tongue in cheek celebration of radical politics and social
activism in New Brunswick. Those who want more information, directions, or
to get involved can either send a message to radicalrush@... or
call 732-846-1056.

Here is a schedule of events that have been planned for the week:

Thursday September 5th - 7:30 PM, Faculty Dining Room, Douglass Student
Center
"Yugoslav Experience and Radical Grass Roots Activism: from Social Forum
to European Social Consulta" a presentation and discussion by Professor
Andrej Grubacic from the University of Belgrade - Yugoslavia. He will
speak about his experiences organizing in Yugoslavia as well as the
tumultuous events that have wrecked havoc on that region. Professor
Grubabcic writes for Z Magazine and is the author of "The Globalization of
Poverty."

Saturday September 7th - 11 am - 6pm, Faculty Dining Room, Douglass
Student Center - "Skill shares and Training for Non-Hierarchal Social
Activism":
This will be a series of skill shares and workshops designed to provide
people with the skills and knowledge necessary for social activism without
hierarchy.

- 11AM-1PM, Know Your Rights: Basic Legal Information and Dealing with
Police Harassment and Intimidation - facilitated by Macdonald Scott from
the National Lawyers Guild

- 2PM-6PM, Facilitating Meetings and Consensus Based Decision Making -
facilitated by Stuart Rockefeller and Lesley Wood from the New York Direct
Action Network: an overview of how to run meetings without hierarchal
chains of command and the sometimes alienating nature of majoritarian
based structures

Sunday September 8th - 11 am - 6 pm, more skill shares

11AM-1PM, Let's Build Those Collectives - facilitated by Moose from the
Anarcho-nyc.net Projects Collective: an introduction on forming
collectives, affinity groups, and other types of organizations used within
social activism by current radicals

2PM-4PM, Activist, Heal Thyself: Basic Medical and First Aid Information -
facilitated by Charlie from the New Jersey Action Medics

4PM-6PM, meeting of the New Jersey Action Network, which is a loose
network of individuals and groups across New Jersey who coordinate
resources and efforts on a variety of progressive issues and concerns

Monday September 9th - Friday September 13th 12PM-5PM, Revolution Summit:
Meet Local Activists and Decide if they're just the Street fighting
hooligans the media portrays

Monday 9/9: outside Brower Commons 12PM-5PM
Tuesday 9/10: on Douglass by Cooper Green 12PM-5PM
Thursday 9/12: on Livingston by Tillet Dining Hall 12PM-5PM
Friday 9/13: on Busch Campus by the Student Center 12PM-5PM

Hope to see you out there.
Love, rage, rationality,
Stevphen, radical rush coordination team

All details are subject to change.





-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Post ID:2929
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-09-05 19:33:51
Subject:ProLibertad Solidarity Digest
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is happy to announce that the Freedom 
Challenge is being met by many activists everyday!!  We are almost at $6000 
out of our $10,000 for Mumia's Legal defense Fund!!

Join the challenge by making a collection for Mumia at your activity, ask 
friends and family to donate some money, make a collection at work, have a 
yard sale, sell off your talents, JUST DO SOMETHING AND HELP PROLIBERTAD 
MEET OUR GOAL: $10,000 FOR MUMIA'S LEGAL DEFENSE FUND!!

To take the challenge contact ProLibertad@... for more information 
on the Challenge!!
________________________________________________________________________

Widening the War Against Terror
THE BUSH ADMINISTRATION'S ATTACK ON CUBA

The Bush administration is stepping up its attack on Cuba, pledging to 
tightenthe U.S. blockade, crack down on U.S. travelers to Cuba, and 
expanding the "axis of evil" to include Cuba. This forum will address how 
Cuba iscountering these attacks and why defending Cuba is so critical, now 
more than ever. The case of the Five Cuban heroes who are unjustly serving 
time in U.S. prisons will be highlighted.

Please join the New York City Committee to Free the Five Cuban Heroes on
September 12 to learn how you can get involved in the campaign to free 
Antonio Guerrero, Gerardo Hernandez, Fernando Gonzalez, Ramon Laba�ino
and Rene Gonzalez.

Forum on Cuba
Thursday, September 12
6:30 p.m.
777 United Nations Plaza
New York City

Sponsored by:
NYC Committee to Free the Five Cuban Heroes
Women for Mutual Security

For more information, contact:
International Action Center (212) 633-6646
IFCO/Pastors for Peace (212) 926-5757

New York City Committee to Free the Five members are:
Casa de las Americas
NYC Free Mumia Coalition
International Action Center
ProLibertad Freedom Campaign
Venceremos Brigade
________________________________________________________________________

HARLEM 9/11 REMEMBRANCE TEACH-IN FOR GLOBAL PEACE AND JUSTICE

Saturday, Sept. 7, 2002 1 to 5 PM

St. Mary's Church @ 521 West 126th Street (Amsterdam & Old Broadway)
New York City

Speakers: Sam Anderson, Father Luis Barrios, Attorney Joan Gibbs,
Samia A. Halaby, Jim Haughton, Hany Kahlil, Monami Maulik, Rosemari
Mealy, Cleo Silver, Lincoln Van Sluytman, and *Housing Panel with
Legal Aid Attorney Adrienne Holder (only African American on Rent
Guideline Board), Hyun Lee (Committee Against Anti- Asian
Violence/CAAAV), Nellie Bailey (Harlem Tenants Council) & Anthony
Williams (Picture the Homeless). Special Presentations: The Case of
the Cuban Five, the Neo-Liberal Impact on Hip Hop Culture & Elombe
Brath, report back on Zimbabwe.

FIGHT BACK AGAINST CUTBACKS & THE WAR.

DEFEND DEMOCRATIC RIGHTS

The Bush Administration is using the tragedy of 9/11 to wage a
"defense of freedom" expanding war of world domination against
mostly poor countries populated by people of color and ruled by
corrupt despots and renegade extremists trained, installed &
maintained in power by the US military. But behind the smoke and
mirrors are disturbing realities: the deepening crisis of world and
domestic capitalism; widening economic gaps between the US elite and
majority working class; repression of civil liberties; and a neo-
liberal agenda carried out by right wing war-hawks illegally
occupying the White House. Join us for the Harlem teach-in with
presentations by a diverse panel of Third World activists on WHY &
HOW we must unite to fight against neo-liberal globalization that
has left millions around the world starving, jobless, homeless and
our environment in peril. SAY NO TO THE $60 BILLION WAR BUSH IS
PUSHING! SAY YES TO LIVING WAGE JOBS, LOW COST HOUSING, HEALTH CARE,
QUALITY EDUCATION

Sponsored by the Harlem Tenants Council, 1 West 125th Street, Room
206, NY, NY 10027. For additional information call 212-316-2240 or
e-mail:harlemtenants@... or nelliehester@....




_________________________________________________________________
Join the world�s largest e-mail service with MSN Hotmail. 
http://www.hotmail.com

Post ID:2932
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-09-08 21:00:02
Subject:ProLibertad Solidarity Calendar
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is calling on all of our supporters to 
attend the following activities this week.

ProLibertad is also making a public call to all supporters of the Puerto 
Rican Political Prisoners and Vieques; to Support the 21 day fast that is 
being called by Todo Puerto Rico con Vieques and the Congreso Hostosiano 
Nacional.  The fast is a symbolic and powerful way of living the struggle to 
remove the US Navy out of Vieques.  Join Esperanza Martell, ProLibertad's 
Fasting Coordinator, and join in on the fast.  Collect the money you would 
have used to buy meals and donate it to Vieques.  If you are interested in 
fasting contact Espe at 212-927-9065.
________________________________________________________________________

Wednesday, Sept 11th, 6pm MEMORIAL CONCERT FOR PEACE & JUSTICE: Third
World Within calls out to communities of color. At Cooper Union in the
Great Hall 7 E 7th St at Astor Place. Free/RSVP. Info: 212-353-7825,
<tww-peaceaction@...>.
________________________________________________________________________

Thursday, Sept 12th, 6:30pm "THE BUSH ADMINISTRATION'S ATTACK ON CUBA"
Ray Laforest (NY Labor Against the War), Teresa Gutierrez (IAC), Rev
Lucius Walker (IFCO/Pastors for Peace), Luis Miranda (CASA de las
Americas), more. At 777 UN Plaza. NYC Cmt to Free the 5 Cuban Heroes.
Info: 212-633-6646, 212-926-5757
________________________________________________________________________

The Puerto Rican Nationalist Party
Celebrates it's 80th Anniversary

The New York Chapter of the Puerto Rican Nationalist Party
invites you to attend a: Dinner & Dance Celebration

Saturday, September 14th, 2002
At:The Julia de Burgos Cultural Center
1680 Lexington Ave. (at 106th Street)

Taller Boricua Gallery II (first floor)

From 5pm to 12 midnight
Tickets: $15

Music: YERBABUENA
Poetry: PRISIONERA

Art Exhibit curated by Mario Cezar Romero
Special Guests:
Rev. Luis Barrios
Dona Rosa Escobar, Activist
Jose Rivera, Assemblyman (Bronx)
Carlos Feliciano, Ex-President (PNPR)

For more information: (917) 597-2488, (917) 834-5341
BoricuaNation@...

http://photos.msn.com/support/worldwide.aspx

Ojeda" (Conversations with Filiberto Ojeda, who is a Machetero/Puerto Rican

Post ID:2937
Sender:"ProLibertad Campaign" <prolibertad@...>
Post Date/Time:2002-09-14 16:45:04
Subject:VIEQUES WALK AND PRISONERS!!
Message:

The ProLibertad Freedom Campaign is urging all supporters of the struggle 
for the Puerto Rican Political Prisoners, Vieques and Puerto Rico to join us 
on Saturday October 26th at St. Mary's Church 521 w126th St. between 
Broadway and Amsterdam Avenue at 10am for the VIEQUES WALK-A-THON!!

ProLibertad is organizing an Oscar Lopez Rivera Contingent to the Vieques 
WALK-A-THON in solidarity with the people of Vieques, their valiant struggle 
to remove the US Navy from Vieques and with Oscar Lopez Rivera, who ran a 
500 mile marathon for Vieques behind the walls of his prison, YOU CAN NEVER 
JAIL OR REPRESS THE SPIRIT OF THE REVOLUTIONARY BORICUA!!

Join the Vieques WALK-A-THON and join the Oscar Lopez Rivera Contingent!!  
Contact ProLibertad@... to join the Oscar Lopez Rivera contingent 
and To register as a walker, to make a monetary pledge, to work as a 
volunteer or to have your  organization become a sponsor, please 
contact:(718)601-4901 (212)348-8004 gee.lee@..., gerena339@...

Sponsorers:
Fundacion Andres Figueroa Cordero
Todo Nueva York Con Vieques
Vieques Support Campaign
ProLibertad
Iglesia Evangelica Espanola
Junta NY-Partido Nacionalista-PR
Iglesia San Romero De Las Americas
IFCO-Pastors For Peace
H.O.L.A., Hoftra Organization of Latin Americans
David Sanes Rodriguez Brigade
Local 1199/SEIU
A.N.S.W.E.R. (Act Now to Stop War & End Racism)
The Bronx Greens
International Action Center
Judy Sheridan, NYS Nurses Association




_________________________________________________________________
MSN Photos is the easiest way to share and print your photos: 
http://photos.msn.com/support/worldwide.aspx

Iglesia San Romero De Las Americas
IFCO-Pastors For Peace
H.O.L.A., Hoftra Organization of Latin Americans
David Sanes Rodriguez Brigade
Local 1199/SEIU
A.N.S.W.E.R. (Act Now to Stop War & End Racism)
The Bronx Greens
International Action Center
Judy Sheridan, NYS Nurses Association
